learningOutcomes.fi:
After the completion of the course the student is able to
  • understand the general context of water and environmental engineering field and its relation to working life practices [knowledge]
  • define the concept of sustainability and understand how scientific, political and regulative frameworks direct the implementation of sustainability in field specific contexts [knowledge]
  • identify, analyse and solve practical challenges in WAT field from a sustainability viewpoint [skill]
  • apply the knowledge and skills gained from previous studies to a practical project [skill]
  • define the elements of project management, the stakeholders of a project, and implement a project in a given time frame [knowledge & skill]
  • disseminate project results in a consise way and with an entrepreneurial mindset [identity]

content.fi: During the course student groups solve a sustainability-related case delivered by working life actors in the WAT field, and report the work orally and also briefly in written form. There are few compulsory contact sessions for the whole class that contribute to students' team work skills, understanding of sustainability as a concept, futures thinking abilities, and to creating the final presentation. Otherwise the group members are expected to organize their work independently during the course and agree on meetings with their mentors, who are representatives from the WAT field.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
  • is familiar with the basic concepts, principles and aims of futures studies.
  • comprehends the role of futures perspective in space and land use context.
  • is able to identify and analyse the different forces of change and their characteristics.
  • is familiar with different methods and tools to support futures consciousness in the real estate market environment.

content.fi: This course aims at enhancing futures thinking skills of students and is especially designed for students interested in tackling challenges related to sustainability and resiliency of future space and land use. The students will gain theoretical understanding of futures studies as well as learn to apply different tools and methodologies in practical oriented cases related to built environment.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After taking this course, you will be able to:
  • explain the interactions between land-use and transport policies
  • elaborate how different stakeholders can influence land-use and transport plans
  • differentiate between alternative types of policy instruments used in land-use and transport plans
  • analyze and assess the impacts of plans, policies and instruments
  • identify the reasons for the constancy and flux of different policies

content.fi:
The course contents include:
  • What’s the problem?
  • Mobility and accessibility.
  • Why and how do governments intervene?
  • Who decides? Who wins, who loses?
  • The public interest.
  • Policy design and integration.
  • Policy assessment and evaluation.
  • Why do policy approaches differ?
  • Policy learning and transfer.
  • Developing policies for sustainable urban development.

name.en: Climate.now - real estate economics and geoinformatics, Lecture

workload.fi: Online-kurssin suoritus, luennot ja harjoitustehtävät. Kts. kurssiesite.
workload.sv: Climate.now-kursen, föreläsningar och övningar. Se kursens beskrivning.
workload.en: Climate.now course, lecture and assignments. See syllabus.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: -
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: -
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: -

learningOutcomes.fi:
Ilmasto.nyt - kiinteistötalous ja geoinformatiikka on 5 opintopisteen laajuinen kokonaisuus ilmastonmuutoksen perusteiden oppimiseen. Kurssi koostuu monialaisesta verkkokurssista ja kiinteistötalouden ja geoinformatiikan aihealueelle keskittyvästä moduulista. Ilmastonmuutos on moniulotteinen aihe, johon liittyy useita poikkitieteellisiä haasteita. Ilmasto.nyt  - kokonaisuuden peruspilarit, joiden ympärille sisältö ja oppimistavoitteet rakentuvat ovat ymmärrys
  • ilmastonmuutoksesta luonnontieteellisenä ilmiönä,
  • kuinka sitä voidaan ehkäistä (hillintä/mitigation),
  • kuinka siihen voidaan sopeutua (adaptation).
Perustiedon hallitsemisen lisäksi, yhtä tärkeänä päämääränä on vahvistaa ymmärrystä ilmastonmuutoksesta syvänä inhimillisenä ja yhteiskunnallisena haasteena ja antaa jokaiselle eväitä olla osaltaan ratkaisemassa sitä. Tavoitteena on, että kokonaisuuden opiskeltuaan opiskelija osaa
  • katsoa ilmastonmuutosta monesta eri näkökulmasta ja luoda yhteyksiä näiden välille sekä etsiä ratkaisuja ilmastonmuutokseen monipuolisesti.
  • reflektoida omaa rooliaan ilmastonmuutoksessa ja soveltaa oppimaansa omalla alallaan.
  • tarkastella eri näkökulmia, ratkaisuja, tiedonlähteitä ja ilmastonmuutoksesta käytävää keskustelua kriittisesti.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Kursen består av en tvärvetenskaplig online kurs och en modul med fokus på fastighetsekonomi och geoinformatik. Klimatförändringar är ett mångdimensionellt ämne som involverar ett antal tvärvetenskapliga utmaningar. De grundläggande pelarna i den enhet kring vilka innehålls- och lärandemål är konstruerade är förståelse av
  • Klimatförändringar som ett naturvetenskapsfenomen
  • Hur kan det förebyggas (mitigation / mitigation)
  • Hur man anpassar sig till det (anpassning/ adaptation).
Förutom hantering av grundläggande information är lika viktigt mål att stärka förståelsen av klimatförändringen som en djup mänsklig och social utmaning och ge alla att kunna bidra till det. Målet är att efter att ha studerat hela studenten kan
  • titta på klimatförändringar från många olika perspektiv och etablera länkar mellan dem, och leta efter mångsidiga lösningar på klimatförändringar
  • reflektera sin egen roll i klimatförändringen och tillämpa sitt lärande i sitt eget område
  • granska olika perspektiv, lösningar, informationskällor och diskussion om klimatförändringen i ett kritisk sätt.
learningOutcomes.en:
Climate.now - real estate economics and geoinformatics is a module for learning the basics of climate change. The course consists of a multidisciplinary online course and a module focusing on the subject matter in the fields on real estate economics and geoinformatics. Climate change is a multidimensional topic with a number of cross-disciplinary challenges. The content and learning outcomes of the Climate.now are based on the understanding of
  • climate change as a scientific phenomenon
  • how it can be prevented (mitigation), and
  • how adaptation is possible.
In addition to providing the basic knowledge, another equally important goal is to reinforce the student’s understanding of climate change as a deep human and societal challenge and to give everyone the means to participate in resolving it. The objective is that, having studied the course, the student can
  • look at climate change from many different perspectives and create connections between them as well as look for solutions to the climate challenge in a variety of ways.
  • reflect on his or her own role in climate change and apply what has been learned on the course to his or her field of study.
  • examine different perspectives, solutions, information sources and the current debate on climate change critically.

content.fi: Ilmastonmuutos, ilmastojärjestelmän toiminta, ilmastonmuutoksen vaikutukset, hillintä ja sopeutuminen.
content.sv: Klimatförändring, klimatsystem, klimatpåverkan, mindring och anpassning.
content.en: Climate change, climate system, impacts, mitigation and adaptation.

name.en: Statistical applications in real estate, Lecture

workload.fi: Luennot, harjoitustyö ja harjoitustyön esittely. Opetus- ja arviointimenetelmät kuvataan tarkemmin vuosittain kurssikuvauksessa
workload.sv: Föreläsningar, övningsarbete och presentation av övningsarbetet. Se kursbeskivning för mer detaljer.
workload.en: Lectures, assingment, presentation. See coure syllabus for more detailed description.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: "Taloustieteen perusteet" sekä ekonometrian/tilastollisen analyysin kurssi. Kurssi on suunniteltu suoritettavaksi samaan aikaan "Kiinteistötalouden perusteet" -kurssin kanssa.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: "Grunderna i ekonomi" och kurs i ekonometri/statistisk analys. Kursen är utformad för att tas samtidigt med "Grunderna i fastighetsekonomi" -kurs.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: "Principles of economics" and a course in econometrics/statistical analysis. The course is designed to be taken simultaneously with "Introduction to real estate economics" -course.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija osaa soveltaa tilastollisia menetelmiä kiinteistötalouden yksinkertaisiin empiirisiin kysymyksiin ja osaa tulkita akateemisten empiiristen tutkimusten tuloksia. Opiskelija tuntee regressioanalyysin periaatteet sekä osaa käyttää tilastollista ohjelmistoa empiiristen aineistojen muokkauksessa sekä ekonometristen mallien estimoinnissa. Opiskelijalla on kurssin jälkeen valmiudet raportoida empiirisen tutkimuksen tulokset itsenäisesti ymmärrettävällä tavalla.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter genomgången kurs kan studenten tillämpa statistiska metoder på enkla empiriska frågor inom fastigheter och kunna tolka resultat av akademisk empirisk forskning. Studenten känner till principerna för regressionsanalys och kan använda statistisk programvara för att redigera empirisk data och skatta ekonometriska modeller. Efter kursen har studenten förmåga att självständigt redovisa resultat av empirisk forskning på ett begripligt sätt.
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course, a student is able to apply statistical methods to simple empirical questions in real estate and is able to interpret the results of academic empirical research. Student knows the principles of regression analysis and is able to use statistical software in editing empirical data and estimating econometric models. After the course, a student has the ability to report the results of empirical research independently in an understandable way.

content.fi:
• Tilastollinen analyysi
  • Regressioanalyysi
  • Hedoninen regressio
  • Kiinteistömarkkina-aineistot
  • Tilasto- ja paikkatieto-ohjelmistot
  • Empiiristen tulosten raportointi
content.sv:
• Statistisk analys
  • Regressionsanalys
  • Hedonisk regression
  • Fastighetsmarknadsdata
  • Programvara för statistisk och rumslig data
  • Redovisning av empiriska resultat
content.en:
• Statistical analysis
  • Regression analysis
  • Hedonic regression
  • Real estate market data
  • Statistical and spatial data software
  • Reporting of empirical results

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the student
  • can explain the basic concepts of the finite element method (FEM) and the finite difference method (FDM).
  • is aware of the potential of FEM and FDM methods to solve partial differential equations.
  • can solve simple engineering problems with FEM and FDM methods and with a mixed FEM-FDM approach.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The student should be able to understand the basics of thermochemical energy conversion processes.
The student should be able to apply this knowledge to judge the chemical energy carriers and their energy conversion technology.
The student shoul be able to recognize how the chemical energy carriers affect the design and operation of practical equipment.

content.fi: Basics of thermochemical energy conversion processes including chemicalreaction kinetics, combustion and flame, ignition, emission mechanisms, heat and energybalances, heat release. Operational considerations of equipment. Application of energyconversion to engines, furnaces and boilers, fundamentals of gasification. The role of energycarriers in applications. Thermochemical energy conversion of biomass and renewablesynthetic fuels. Recovery boilers.

learningOutcomes.fi: After this course student can apply and evaluate different geometric design elements and understands their mathematical basis. Student is able to analyze how road geometry affects roadside safety, and how road alignment interacts with surrounding landscape and urban space. Student understands the role of the planning phase of a road as a part of life cycle of a road.
learningOutcomes.sv: After this course student can apply and evaluate different geometric design elements and understands their mathematical basis. content.fi: - Development and applications of concepts of geometric design for rural and urban roads- Design controls and criteria.- Design elements and their use (sight distance, horizontal and vertical alignment, cross-section elements, highway types, intersection design elements, types of interchanges and interchange design elements, grade separations, and clearance)- Road location in a landscape (engineering, economic, and social aspects, ecology, aesthetics)- Design of streets- Drainage and road environment- Roadside safety and environment- Road planning process (plans, specifications, and controls)- Planning as a part of a life cycle of a road
content.sv: - Development and applications of concepts of geometric design for rural and urban roads- Design controls and criteria.- Design elements and their use (sight distance, horizontal and vertical alignment, cross-section elements, highway types, intersection design elements, types of interchanges and interchange design elements, grade separations, and clearance)- Road location in a landscape (engineering, economic, and social aspects, ecology, aesthetics)- Design of streets- Drainage and road environment- Roadside safety and environment- Road planning process (plans, specifications, and controls)- Planning as a part of a life cycle of a road

name.en: Special Course on Land Management D, Lecture

workload.fi: Luennot, harjoitustyöt, tentti
workload.sv: Föreläsningar, övningar, tentamen
workload.en: Lectures, assignments and exam

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics Lisäksi suositellaan REC-E4500 Land management REC-E4700 Environmental law
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics Också rekommenderat REC-E4500 Land management REC-E4700 Environmental law
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics Also recommended REC-E4500 Land management REC-E4700 Environmental law

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
  • tuntee oleellisimmat julkishallinnon kiinteistötehtävät
  • tunnistaa kiinteistötoimituksissa noudatettavan lainsäädännön, osaa etsiä lakien perusteluja, ennakkopäätöksiä, asiaan liittyvää kirjallisuutta ja ohjeistusta sekä ymmärtää, millä perusteilla oikeudellinen päätös annetaan.
  • ymmärtää maapolitiikan keskeiset keinot, asemakaavojen toteuttamisen prosessit ja osaa arvioida asemakaavan toteuttamistaloutta.
  • hahmottaa kuntien ja valtion tietojärjestelmien rajapinnat sekä kiinteistö-, rakennus-, osoite- ja kiinteistöverotietojen liikkumisen kuntien ja valtion välillä.
  • hahmottaa kuntien ja maanmittauslaitoksen viranomaistoiminnan vaikuttavuuden yhteiskunnan toimivuuteen.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter avklarad kurs har studenten följande kunskap
  • känner till de väsentligaste fastighetsuppgifterna inom offentlig förvaltning
  • känner till lagstiftningen gällande fastighetsförrättningar, kan söka i lagarnas förarbeten, prejudikat, litteraturen och direktiv samt förstå på vilka grunder ett juridiskt beslut fattas
  • förstår de centrala metoderna inom markpolitik och känner processerna hur detaljplaner förverkligas samt kan bedöma genomförandeekonomin för en detaljplan
  • känner till kontaktytorna mellan statens och kommunernas informationssystem samt hur fastighets-, byggnads-, adress- och fastighetsskatteuppgifter flyttas mellan staten och kommunerna
  • känner till hur kommunernas och Lantmäteriverkets myndighetsutövning inverkar på hur samhället fungerar
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, the student
  • knows the most prominent tasks of public administration related to real estates
  • recognizes the juridical sources in cadastral procedures and understands the juridical grounds for decisions, and knows the legal sources
  • understands the essentials of land (use) policy, processes of realizing detailed land use plans and is able to evaluate the economics of land use plan
  • understands the outline of the interfaces between municipalities' and national information systems
  • understands the role of the public administration of municipalities and the national land survey in the functions of society

content.fi:
• Maanmittauslaitoksen ja kaupunkien maanhallinta
  • Kiinteistöjärjestelmä ja kiinteistönmuodostus.
  • Kaupunkirakenteen kehittäminen, kaavoituksen toteuttaminen, maapolitiikka.
  • Maaseudun kiinteistörakenteen kehittäminen. Suomalainen lunastusjärjestelmä.
  • Maanmittaustehtävien tietojärjestelmät.
content.sv:
• Lantmäteriverkets och städernas markförvaltning
  • Fastighetssystemet och fastighetsbildning
  • Utveckling av stadsstrukturen, förverkligande av planläggning, markpolitik
  • Utveckling av fastighetsstrukturen på landsbygden. Det finska inlösningssystemet
  • Informationssystem inom lantmäteriuppgifter
content.en:
• Public land administration
  • Cadastral system and real estate formation
  • Development of urban structure, realization of land use plan, land policy
  • Development of rural property structure. Finnish expropriation system.
  • Information systems of public land administration

name.en: Special Course on Land Management D, Exam

workload.fi: Luennot, harjoitustyöt, tentti
workload.sv: Föreläsningar, övningar, tentamen
workload.en: Lectures, assignments and exam

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics Lisäksi suositellaan REC-E4500 Land management REC-E4700 Environmental law
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics Också rekommenderat REC-E4500 Land management REC-E4700 Environmental law
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics Also recommended REC-E4500 Land management REC-E4700 Environmental law

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija
  • tuntee oleellisimmat julkishallinnon kiinteistötehtävät
  • tunnistaa kiinteistötoimituksissa noudatettavan lainsäädännön, osaa etsiä lakien perusteluja, ennakkopäätöksiä, asiaan liittyvää kirjallisuutta ja ohjeistusta sekä ymmärtää, millä perusteilla oikeudellinen päätös annetaan.
  • ymmärtää maapolitiikan keskeiset keinot, asemakaavojen toteuttamisen prosessit ja osaa arvioida asemakaavan toteuttamistaloutta.
  • hahmottaa kuntien ja valtion tietojärjestelmien rajapinnat sekä kiinteistö-, rakennus-, osoite- ja kiinteistöverotietojen liikkumisen kuntien ja valtion välillä.
  • hahmottaa kuntien ja maanmittauslaitoksen viranomaistoiminnan vaikuttavuuden yhteiskunnan toimivuuteen.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter avklarad kurs har studenten följande kunskap
  • känner till de väsentligaste fastighetsuppgifterna inom offentlig förvaltning
  • känner till lagstiftningen gällande fastighetsförrättningar, kan söka i lagarnas förarbeten, prejudikat, litteraturen och direktiv samt förstå på vilka grunder ett juridiskt beslut fattas
  • förstår de centrala metoderna inom markpolitik och känner processerna hur detaljplaner förverkligas samt kan bedöma genomförandeekonomin för en detaljplan
  • känner till kontaktytorna mellan statens och kommunernas informationssystem samt hur fastighets-, byggnads-, adress- och fastighetsskatteuppgifter flyttas mellan staten och kommunerna
  • känner till hur kommunernas och Lantmäteriverkets myndighetsutövning inverkar på hur samhället fungerar
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, the student
  • knows the most prominent tasks of public administration related to real estates
  • recognizes the juridical sources in cadastral procedures and understands the juridical grounds for decisions, and knows the legal sources
  • understands the essentials of land (use) policy, processes of realizing detailed land use plans and is able to evaluate the economics of land use plan
  • understands the outline of the interfaces between municipalities' and national information systems
  • understands the role of the public administration of municipalities and the national land survey in the functions of society

content.fi:
• Maanmittauslaitoksen ja kaupunkien maanhallinta
  • Kiinteistöjärjestelmä ja kiinteistönmuodostus.
  • Kaupunkirakenteen kehittäminen, kaavoituksen toteuttaminen, maapolitiikka.
  • Maaseudun kiinteistörakenteen kehittäminen. Suomalainen lunastusjärjestelmä.
  • Maanmittaustehtävien tietojärjestelmät.
content.sv:
• Lantmäteriverkets och städernas markförvaltning
  • Fastighetssystemet och fastighetsbildning
  • Utveckling av stadsstrukturen, förverkligande av planläggning, markpolitik
  • Utveckling av fastighetsstrukturen på landsbygden. Det finska inlösningssystemet
  • Informationssystem inom lantmäteriuppgifter
content.en:
• Public land administration
  • Cadastral system and real estate formation
  • Development of urban structure, realization of land use plan, land policy
  • Development of rural property structure. Finnish expropriation system.
  • Information systems of public land administration

name.sv: Random Loads and Processes D, Föreläsning
name.en: Random Loads and Processes D, Lecture

workload.fi:
Lectures: 24h (12 x 2h/week) Home assignments: 50h (5 biweekly assignments, each 10 hr) Studying materials: 50 h* Preparing for exam: 10 h** A learning diary should easily fit in these 60 hours.
There will be optional MATLAB exercise session for students who need assistance with MATLAB.

prerequisites.fi: B.Sc. studies
prerequisites.sv: B.Sc. studies
prerequisites.en: B.Sc. studies

learningOutcomes.fi: The aim of the course is to introduce the student to theoretical treatment random (stochastic) processes such as loads due to wave and wind on structures. After the course the student knows basics of probability concepts and how these are applied in mechanics; knows the random variables and how various probability distributions are connected; can apply time-domain measurements and convert them to frequency domain to define load spectrum in (spectral analysis) and can estimate the probability of exceedance of certain load from the load spectrum (extreme values). In addition the student can define the response (e.g. stress) for linear system (transfer function).
learningOutcomes.sv: The aim of the course is to introduce the student to theoretical treatment random (stochastic) processes such as loads due to wave and wind on structures. In addition the student can define the response (e.g. stress) for linear system (transfer function).

In addition the student can define the response (e.g. stress) for linear system (transfer function).

literature.en: Lecture notes Selected articles J.J.H. Brouwers, Stochastic Processes in Mechanical Engineering , Eindhoven University of Technology Naess, A. and Moan, T. Stochastic Dynamics of Marine Structures , Cambridge University Press

content.fi: General description of random variables and their properties and continuous and discrete probability distributions. Introduction to random vibrations. Fourier-transformation of for random vibrations. Single degree of freedom system in frequency domain. Gaussian signal in time domain. Random vibrations of beams and strings. Peak and extreme value statistics.
content.sv: General description of random variables and their properties and continuous and discrete probability distributions. Introduction to random vibrations. Fourier-transformation of for random vibrations. Single degree of freedom system in frequency domain. Gaussian signal in time domain. Random vibrations of beams and strings. Peak and extreme value statistics.
content.en: General description of random variables and their properties and continuous and discrete probability distributions. Introduction to random vibrations. Fourier-transformation of for random vibrations. Single degree of freedom system in frequency domain. Gaussian signal in time domain. Random vibrations of beams and strings. Peak and extreme value statistics.

assesmentMethods.fi:
The course utilizes problem-based-learning concept. The aim of the course is to identify, categorize, analyse and synthesize the random loads for selected engineering application. This goal is acchieved through 5 steps which include the identification of the problem, characterization of the environment, analysing the response for random exitation, definition of the short and long term responses and statistics (fatigue and ultimate limit states). Every two weeks we define a subtask to be solved, lectures will be given and we have question hour where students can ask questions related to their projects. Every two weeks, the student groups (3-5 persons) return a written report showing in the form of living document that build the course report in steps. The bi-weekly submissions will be graded from 1-5. 
The bi-weekly assignment submissions will contribute up to 50% of the course grade. The remaining 50% of the grade is defined by the final exam.

prerequisites.en: It is recommended (but not mandatory) to take courses GIS-E1020 From Measurements to Maps and GIS-E1040 Photogrammetry, Laser Scanning and Remote Sensing before participating in this course.

learningOutcomes.fi: Ymmärtää laserkeilauksen erikoissovelluksia. Ymmärtää liikkuvan, lennokkipohjaisen, multi- ja hyperspektrikeilauksen periaatteita. Ymmärtää ja soveltaa 3D-pistepilvien käsittelyalgoritmeja. Ymmärtää ja soveltaa laserkeilauksen ja muista lähteistä saatavien aineistojen rekisteröintiä ja yhteensovittamista.
learningOutcomes.sv: Att förstå speciella tillämpningar av laserskanning. Att förstå mobil, UAV- och multi-/hyperspektral laserskanning. Att förstå och tillämpa algoritmer för behandling av 3D-punktmoln. Att förstå och tillämpa registrering och integration av data från laserskanning med andra datakällor.
learningOutcomes.en: To understand special applications of laser scanning. To understand mobile, UAV and multi-/hyperspectral laser scanning. To understand and apply processing algorithms of 3D point clouds. To understand and apply registration and integration of laser scanning data with other data sources.

literature.en: Lecture notes and additional literature
literature.fi: Luentokalvot ja muu materiaali
literature.sv: Föreläsningsanteckningar och ytterligare litteratur

content.fi: Kurssi luo syvällisempää näkemystä laserkeilausmenetelmistä, kuten  liikkuvan, lennokkipohjaisen, multi- ja hyperspektrikeilauksen soveltamisesta, käsikeilaimista sekä soveltuvista mittaus- ja mallinnusohjelmista. Lisäksi käsitellään 3D-aineistojen prosessointi- ja yhteensovitusalgoritmeja. Kurssiin sisältyy myös osa, jossa havainnollistetaan uusinta laserteknologiaa ja sovelluksia.
content.sv: Kursen ger en djupare inblick i laserskanningsmetoder, såsom användning av mobil laserskanning, UAV-laserskannrar och handhållna skannrar, multi- och hyperspektral laserskanning, och speciella tillämpningar av laserskanning. Dessutom betonas algoritmer för behandling av 3D-data och integration med andra datakällor. Kursen innehåller också en seminariedel där den senaste utvecklingen inom laserskanning illustreras.
content.en: This course gives a deeper insight on laser scanning methods such as the use of mobile laser scanning, UAV laser scanners, multi- and hyperspectral laser scanning, handheld scanners, and special applications of laser scanning. In addition, algorithms of 3D data processing and integration with other data sources are emphasized. The course includes also a seminar part in which the recent development of laser scanning is illustrated.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the completion of the course the student is able to
  • understand the fundamentals of sustainable infrastructures in rapidly developing world
  • explain connections and linkages between different sustainable technologies and infrastructure systems in built environments (water, waste, energy, transport, building design and construction, land tenure and land use)
  • comprehend principles of resilient communities
  • understand vulnerability of built environments
  • work in multicultural teams and recognize his/her own expertise as part of the team or design problem

content.fi: The course covers fundamentals of basic infrastructures focusing on sustainable technologies, infrastructures and policies aiming for environmentally, culturally and economically more sustainable built environments globally. The key content covers water, energy, waste management, housing, land use, climate change, vulnerability and resilient communities. Course provides multidisciplinary and multicultural learning environment.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the completion of the course the student is able to
  • understand the diverse linkages and relations from technology, innovations, design and entrepreneurship to socially, economically and environmentally sustainable development
  • know different approaches and methods to analyze and implement projects involving such linkages, with in-depth knowledge of at least one such method in the specific setting of their project work
  • review and use key readings related to global sustainability and technology linkages
  • write project proposals, plans and reports, and put into practice different phases of international project work through an array of organizational and business models (governmental, non-governmental, business and academic)
  • work in an interactive manner as part of a team, and is familiar with the challenges and possibilities included in working in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams
  • recognize and analyze their own as well as others' roles and responsibilities in a team
  • communicate and present the main outcomes of the project work in clear oral and written manner
  • recognize main methods (project work, research, implementation) used in international development and innovation projects
  • recognize different actors and stakeholders in the field of their own project, and communicate with them

content.fi:
SGT Studio is a co-learning studio for Master's and PhD students working with various stakeholders. The course looks at the diverse, multi- and cross-disciplinary connections between sustainability and technology in developing contexts. The course includes expert lectures, interactive workshops and extensive project work done in teams. As part of the team work, students may travel abroad to carry out field studies on their selected theme. The lecturers and workshops introduce students to the general context of the course as well as to the process of multicultural project work and team work.
In this course students will take part in real-life projects within research groups, civil society organizations or companies. The project work will be mentored by Aalto's research staff and practicing professionals.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completion of the course the student
  • Understands the key characteristics of water governance and its link to sustainability [knowledge]
  • Recognises the key institutions and actors related to water governance in different settings [knowledge]
  • Understands the role of legislation in relation to water management and governance [knowledge]
  • Can apply selected approaches and methods for water governance analysis [skill]
  • Is able to work in an interactive manner as part of a group, including reading and discussing scientific literature [identity]

content.fi: The main themes of the course include water governance and its key elements at different scales; policy-making and institutions in water resources management; and water-related laws and agreements as well as impact assessment and permitting processes. Methodologically, the course introduces the student to basic approaches and methods related to governance analysis through a Case study.

Methodologically, the course introduces the student to basic approaches and methods related to governance analysis through a Case study.

learningOutcomes.fi:
• The primary outcome of the summer school is acquisition of Innovation & Entrepreneurship skills by the participants empowering their potential to generate value for the manufacturing world.
  • Additionally, the team work environment and the social program organized during the 3-week period of the school facilitate the creation of a network of future professionals that will last well beyond the school duration.
  • The close interaction between students, companies, lecturers and innovation experts create a fertile ground for the generation of new ideas that can be exploited by all the actors taking part to the school leading to the creation of additional value in their business environment.
  • More detailed learning objectives will be provided later.

• The primary outcome of the summer school is acquisition of Innovation & Entrepreneurship skills by the participants empowering their potential to generate value for the manufacturing world.
  • Additionally, the team work environment and the social program organized during the 3-week period of the school facilitate the creation of a network of future professionals that will last well beyond the school duration.
  • The close interaction between students, companies, lecturers and innovation experts create a fertile ground for the generation of new ideas that can be exploited by all the actors taking part to the school leading to the creation of additional value in their business environment.
  • More detailed learning objectives will be provided later.

content.fi:
The Summer School focuses on Manufacturing technological trends, environmental and societal challenges and in developing innovation and entrepreneurship skills for the manufacturing world. The main topics include product/service design, ethical, societal and sustainability aspects, business model, stakeholders analysis, revenue model, business pitch, market and competitors analysis, IPR, go-to market strategy, business development strategy, financing, and risk analysis.
The Summer School provides, wherever needed, a preparatory phase through digital content, to allow all students to get the same basic knowledge.
The Summer School includes front lessons and a learning by doing approach. During the lessons speakers from companies, business evangelists, business angels and entrepreneurs, active in the field of manufacturing, share their thoughts and experiences, and professors from leading universities provide the needed theoretical framework of innovation and entrepreneurship. Moreover, the students face challenges, provided by real cases, and develop their innovative ideas for a more sustainable manufacturing. They also learn how to pitch their ideas in front of a panel of leading experts.
The real case assigned is developed along the Summer School duration time through the support of specific mentors. During the final pitch the students demonstrate the result of the achieved new skills and capabilities.
The purpose of the summer school is to develop students’ creativity, problem solving, innovation and entrepreneurship, leadership and sustainability skills and their intercultural and international network.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, students are able to
• understand resource-light product development processes, methods and  management in a startup context
• be familiar with a range of approaches and methods to understanding and 
discovering user and customer needs
• be able to identify and test assumptions in product ideas and effectively utilize customer feedback
• be familiar with a range of approaches and methods for quick exploration to develop ideas into MVPs

content.fi: Students work individually and in interdisciplinary teams to explore how products are developed in resource-light startup environments. Through real startup cases and hands-on exercises, they learn to understand user and customer needs, identify and test key assumptions in product ideas, and use feedback to guide development. Lectures and workshops introduce practical tools for ideation, prototyping, assumption testing, and MVP development. The course culminates in a final showcase where students present the outcomes of their product development work.

assesmentMethods.fi: Assessment focuses on students’ overall engagement with key concepts, methods, and practices related to early-stage product development. Emphasis is placed on the ability to apply learning in practical, team-based contexts, to communicate ideas clearly, and to contribute actively in class activities. A mix of individual and group work is assessed, alongside self- and peer-evaluation, which may influence the final grade.

workload.fi:
The course utilizes guided problem-based learning concept. The content is cross-disciplinary and is suitable for students of different backgrounds. On-line lectures introduce topics which are then considered with respect to the projects. Work is performed in cross-disciplinary groups. Progress of the project is checked on weekly basis. The final project is presented in the end of the course to experts from industry and academia.
Lectures: 10h (2h/week, 5 weeks)
Instructed workshops: 6h (1h/week, 6 weeks)
Group work: 55h (10 hours/week, 6 weeks)
Independent work for the group project: 55h (9 hours/week, 6 weeks)

content.fi: Vesihuollon historia, liitynnät muuhun infrastruktuuriin ja toimijat. Talousveden hankinta pohja- ja pintavedestä. Talousveden jakelu, pumppaus ja paineellisen putken hydrauliikka. Talousvesijärjestelmän osat ja veden käyttö. Talousveden laatu, riskit ja niiden hallinta. Vesihuoltoverkostojen suunnittelu, rakentaminen, käyttö ja saneeraus. Viemäröintijärjestelmän osat ja gravitaatioputken hydrauliikka. Jäteveden laatu, käsittelytarve ja lieteratkaisut. Hulevesijärjestelmän osat, hulevesien muodostuminen ja niiden hallinta.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin tavoitteena on oppia
  • Suuttimien perusteoria. Kuinka virtauksen paine, lämpötila ja tiheys muuttuvat suuttimen läpi kuljettaessa
  • Energiataseen käyttö turbiinien sisällä tapahtuvan kaasun tai höyryn käyttäytymisen karkeaan analysoimiseen 
  • Pumppujen ja puhaltimien perusteoria sekä mitoitus putkistoja varten kokoonpuristumattoman virtauksen tapauksessa.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Målet med kursen är att lära
  • Grundläggande teori om munstycken. Hur flödets tryck, temperatur och täthet förändras när det passerar genom munstycket
  • Användning av energibalans för att grovt analysera gas- eller ångbeteende i turbiner
  • Grundläggande teori om pumpar och fläktar och dimensionering för rörledningar vid inkompressibelt flöde.
learningOutcomes.en:
The aim of the course is to learn
  • Basic theory of nozzles. How the pressure, temperature and density of the flow change as it passes through the nozzle
  • Use of energy balance to roughly analyze gas or steam behavior inside turbines
  • Basic theory of pumps and fans and dimensioning for pipelines in case of incompressible flow.

content.fi: Kurssilla tarkastellaan teollisuudessa ja energiatekniikassa kohdattavien komponenttien toimintaa termodynamiikan näkökulmasta. Erityisen tarkastelun kohteena ovat suuttimet, turbiinit sekä pumput ja puhaltimet. Suuttimien tapauksessa kurssilla selvitetään poikkipinta-alan, virtausnopeuden sekä termodynaamisten suureiden kuten paineen ja tiheyden välinen yhteys. Turbiinien kohdalla hyödynnetään suuttimien teoriaa ja tarkastellaan virtaavan höyryn ja kaasun entalpian muuntamista kineettiseksi energiaksi ja turbiinin pyörimisenergiaksi. Näin pyritään esittelemään impulssija reaktioturbiinien toimintaperiaatteet sekä havainnollistamaan turbiinin säätämistä massavirran muuttamisella. Pumppujen ja puhaltimien kohdalla keskitytään selvittämään, kuinka paineen kasvu saadaan aikaan, ja miten usean komponentin rinnan- tai sarjaankytkentä vaikuttaa lopputulokseen putkiverkostoissa.
content.sv: Kursen undersöker funktionen av komponenter som förekommer inom industri och energiteknik ur termodynamikens perspektiv. Munstycken, turbiner samt pumpar och fläktar är föremål för särskild granskning. När det gäller munstycken undersöks i kursen sambandet mellan tvärsnittsarea, flödeshastighet och termodynamiska storheter såsom tryck och densitet. När det gäller turbiner används teorin om munstycken och entalpiomvandlingen av strömmande ånga och gas till turbinens kinetiska energi och rotationsenergi undersöks. På så sätt är syftet att presentera driftprinciperna för impuls- och reaktionsturbiner och att illustrera justeringen av turbinen genom att förändra massflödet. När det gäller pumpar och fläktar ligger fokus på att ta reda på hur tryckökningen uppnås, och hur parallell- eller seriekoppling av flera komponenter påverkar slutresultatet i rörnät
content.en: The course examines the operation of components encountered in industry and energy technology from the perspective of thermodynamics. Nozzles, turbines as well as pumps and fans are the subject of special scrutiny. In the case of nozzles, the course examines the connection between cross-sectional area, flow rate and thermodynamic quantities such as pressure and density. In the case of turbines, the theory of nozzles is utilized and the enthalpy conversion of flowing steam and gas into kinetic energy and rotational energy of the turbine is examined. In this way, the aim is to present the operating principles of impulse and reaction turbines and to illustrate the adjustment of the turbine by changing the mass flow. In the case of pumps and fans, the focus is on finding out how the increase in pressure is achieved, and how the parallel or series connection of several components affects the final result in pipe networks.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin tavoitteena on oppia
  • Suuttimien perusteoria. Kuinka virtauksen paine, lämpötila ja tiheys muuttuvat suuttimen läpi kuljettaessa
  • Energiataseen käyttö turbiinien sisällä tapahtuvan kaasun tai höyryn käyttäytymisen karkeaan analysoimiseen 
  • Pumppujen ja puhaltimien perusteoria sekä mitoitus putkistoja varten kokoonpuristumattoman virtauksen tapauksessa.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: Housing economics, Real Estate Economics, Urban EconomicsRecommended prerequisites: Econometrics I ECON-C4110 or equivalent prerequisites. It is expected that students use statistical program Stata or R in the assignments. Teacher uses Stata.
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: Housing economics, Real Estate Economics, Urban EconomicsRecommended prerequisites: Econometrics I ECON-C4110 or equivalent prerequisites. It is expected that students use statistical program Stata or R in the assignments. Teacher uses Stata.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, students understand the difference between correlation and causation and know what to look when reading research articles that make causal claims. The students understand and are able to replicate most common econometric research designs that allow causal interpretation, using econometric software Stata or R (Stata is used teaching and demonstrations). In addition, the students are able to apply these research designs to topical research questions in Real Estate Economics.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: EKO-C2001 Termodynamiikan ja lämmönsiirron perusteet
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: EKO-C2001 Termodynamiikan ja lämmönsiirron perusteet
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: EKO-C2001 Termodynamiikan ja lämmönsiirron perusteet

learningOutcomes.fi: Opiskelija osaa muodostaa energia- ja massataseita kemiallisia reaktioita sisältäville systeemeille, sekä systeemeille, joissa kostean ilman termodynamiikalla on keskeinen rooli. Opiskelija ymmärtää faasitasapainon periaatteen ja osaa laskea kemiallisten reaktioiden tasapainon käyttämällä sekä tasapainovakiota että minimoimalla systeemin Gibbsin energian. Opiskelija tunnistaa ideaali- ja reaaliliuosten käsitteet sekä osaa soveltaa ideaaliliuosten teoriaa yksinkertaisiin liuoslaskelmiin, kuten liuoksen kiehumis- ja jäätymispisteen määrittämiseen.  Opiskelija osaa tehdä yksinkertaisia exergialaskelmia energiatekniikassa esiintyville laitteille. Opiskelija ymmärtää sähkökemiallisen systeemin idean sekä osaa tehdä termodynaamisia laskelmia polttokennoille ja elektrolyysereille. Opiskelija tuntee vastaavien tilojen periaatteen sekä osaa käyttää yleistä kokoonpuristuvuusdiagrammia.
learningOutcomes.sv: Studerandet vet hur man bildar energi- och massbalanser för system med kemiska reaktioner, samt för system där termodynamik av fuktig luft spelar en central roll. Studerandet förstår principen om fasjämvikt och vet hur man beräknar jämvikten för kemiska reaktioner genom att använda både jämviktskonstanten och minimering av systemets Gibbs-energi. Studerandet känner igen begreppen ideala och reala lösningar och vet hur man tillämpar teorin om ideala lösningar på enkla lösningsberäkningar, såsom bestämning av en lösnings kok- och fryspunkt. Studerandet vet hur man gör enkla exergiberäkningar för energitekniska system. Studerandet förstår hur ett elektrokemiskt system fungerar och vet hur man gör termodynamiska beräkningar för bränsleceller och elektrolysanläggningar. Studerandet känner till hur man använder ett allmänt kompressibilitetsdiagram.
learningOutcomes.en: A student knows how to make energy and mass balances for systems with chemical reactions, and for systems where thermodynamics of humid air has an important role. A student knows what phase equilibrium means and can calculate the phase equilibrium of chemical reactions using both equilibrium constant and minimization of Gibbs energy. A student recognizes the most common ideal and real solution models and can calculate freezing and boiling point for a solution. A student knows what exergy means and can make exergy calculations for basic energy systems. A student understands operational principle of an electrochemical system and can make thermodynamic calculations for a fuel cell and an electrolyser. A student recognizes principle of the corresponding states and can use generalized compressibility chart for gases.

content.fi: Muodostumisentalpia, tuntuva entalpia, absoluuttinen entropia, muodostumisentropia, kemiallinen potentiaali, Gibbsin energia, exergia, faasitasapaino, kemiallisen reaktion tasapaino, Raoultin ja Henryn laki, reaaliliuos, vastaavien tilojen periaate, kostean ilman termodynamiikka (absoluuttinen kosteus, suhteellinen kosteus, kastepiste, märkälämpötila jne.) sekä sähkökemiallisen systeemi painottuen erityisesti polttokennoon ja elektrolyysiin.
content.sv: Bildningsentalpi, sensibelt entalpi, absolut entropi, bildningsentropi, kemisk potential, Gibbs energi, exergi, fasjämvikt, jämnvikt av en kemisk reaktion, Raoults lag, Henrys lag, reala lösningar, lagen om korresponderande tillstånd, termodynamik av fuktig luft (absolut fuktighet, relativ fuktighet, daggpunkttemperatur, våttemperatur etc.) samt ett elektrokemiskt system (särskilt bränsleceller och elektrolys).
content.en: Enthalpy of formation, sensible enthalpy, absolute entropy, entropy of formation, chemical potential, Gibbs energy, phase equilibrium, equilibrium of a chemical reaction, exergy, Raoult’s law, Henry’s law, real solutions, principle of the corresponding state, thermodynamics of humid air (absolute humidity, relative humidity, dew point temperature, wet bulb temperature etc.) and electrochemical systems (especially fuel cells and electrolysis).

assesmentMethods.fi: Tentti + laskuharjoitukset. Kurssin ainoa läpipääsyvaatimus on saada tentistä 9/24 pistettä. Laskuharjoituksista voi saada maksimissaan 3 lisäpistettä, jotka lisätään tenttipisteihin sen jälkeen, kun opiskelija on saanut vähintään 9 pistettä tentistä.
assesmentMethods.sv: Tentamen + räkneövningar. Studerandet måste få 9/24 poäng i tentamen för att klara kursen. Det är möjligt att samla maximalt 3 extra poäng genom att lämna in räkneövningar under kursen. Tentamen- och räkneövningspoäng räknas ihop sen studerandet har fått minst 9 poäng i tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: Exam + Calculation exercises. The only requirement to pass the course is to get 9/24 points in the exam. A student can get extra points by submitting calculation exercises during the course. These points are taken into account since the student has passed the exam.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: EKO-C2001 Termodynamiikan ja lämmönsiirron perusteet
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: EKO-C2001 Termodynamiikan ja lämmönsiirron perusteet
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: EKO-C2001 Termodynamiikan ja lämmönsiirron perusteet

learningOutcomes.fi: Opiskelija osaa muodostaa energia- ja massataseita kemiallisia reaktioita sisältäville systeemeille, sekä systeemeille, joissa kostean ilman termodynamiikalla on keskeinen rooli. Opiskelija ymmärtää faasitasapainon periaatteen ja osaa laskea kemiallisten reaktioiden tasapainon käyttämällä sekä tasapainovakiota että minimoimalla systeemin Gibbsin energian. Opiskelija tunnistaa ideaali- ja reaaliliuosten käsitteet sekä osaa soveltaa ideaaliliuosten teoriaa yksinkertaisiin liuoslaskelmiin, kuten liuoksen kiehumis- ja jäätymispisteen määrittämiseen.  Opiskelija osaa tehdä yksinkertaisia exergialaskelmia energiatekniikassa esiintyville laitteille. Opiskelija ymmärtää sähkökemiallisen systeemin idean sekä osaa tehdä termodynaamisia laskelmia polttokennoille ja elektrolyysereille. Opiskelija tuntee vastaavien tilojen periaatteen sekä osaa käyttää yleistä kokoonpuristuvuusdiagrammia.
learningOutcomes.sv: Studerandet vet hur man bildar energi- och massbalanser för system med kemiska reaktioner, samt för system där termodynamik av fuktig luft spelar en central roll. Studerandet förstår principen om fasjämvikt och vet hur man beräknar jämvikten för kemiska reaktioner genom att använda både jämviktskonstanten och minimering av systemets Gibbs-energi. Studerandet känner igen begreppen ideala och reala lösningar och vet hur man tillämpar teorin om ideala lösningar på enkla lösningsberäkningar, såsom bestämning av en lösnings kok- och fryspunkt. Studerandet vet hur man gör enkla exergiberäkningar för energitekniska system. Studerandet förstår hur ett elektrokemiskt system fungerar och vet hur man gör termodynamiska beräkningar för bränsleceller och elektrolysanläggningar. Studerandet känner till hur man använder ett allmänt kompressibilitetsdiagram.
learningOutcomes.en: A student knows how to make energy and mass balances for systems with chemical reactions, and for systems where thermodynamics of humid air has an important role. A student knows what phase equilibrium means and can calculate the phase equilibrium of chemical reactions using both equilibrium constant and minimization of Gibbs energy. A student recognizes the most common ideal and real solution models and can calculate freezing and boiling point for a solution. A student knows what exergy means and can make exergy calculations for basic energy systems. A student understands operational principle of an electrochemical system and can make thermodynamic calculations for a fuel cell and an electrolyser. A student recognizes principle of the corresponding states and can use generalized compressibility chart for gases.

content.fi: Muodostumisentalpia, tuntuva entalpia, absoluuttinen entropia, muodostumisentropia, kemiallinen potentiaali, Gibbsin energia, exergia, faasitasapaino, kemiallisen reaktion tasapaino, Raoultin ja Henryn laki, reaaliliuos, vastaavien tilojen periaate, kostean ilman termodynamiikka (absoluuttinen kosteus, suhteellinen kosteus, kastepiste, märkälämpötila jne.) sekä sähkökemiallisen systeemi painottuen erityisesti polttokennoon ja elektrolyysiin.
content.sv: Bildningsentalpi, sensibelt entalpi, absolut entropi, bildningsentropi, kemisk potential, Gibbs energi, exergi, fasjämvikt, jämnvikt av en kemisk reaktion, Raoults lag, Henrys lag, reala lösningar, lagen om korresponderande tillstånd, termodynamik av fuktig luft (absolut fuktighet, relativ fuktighet, daggpunkttemperatur, våttemperatur etc.) samt ett elektrokemiskt system (särskilt bränsleceller och elektrolys).
content.en: Enthalpy of formation, sensible enthalpy, absolute entropy, entropy of formation, chemical potential, Gibbs energy, phase equilibrium, equilibrium of a chemical reaction, exergy, Raoult’s law, Henry’s law, real solutions, principle of the corresponding state, thermodynamics of humid air (absolute humidity, relative humidity, dew point temperature, wet bulb temperature etc.) and electrochemical systems (especially fuel cells and electrolysis).

assesmentMethods.fi: Tentti + laskuharjoitukset. Kurssin ainoa läpipääsyvaatimus on saada tentistä 9/24 pistettä. Laskuharjoituksista voi saada maksimissaan 3 lisäpistettä, jotka lisätään tenttipisteihin sen jälkeen, kun opiskelija on saanut vähintään 9 pistettä tentistä.
assesmentMethods.sv: Tentamen + räkneövningar. Studerandet måste få 9/24 poäng i tentamen för att klara kursen. Det är möjligt att samla maximalt 3 extra poäng genom att lämna in räkneövningar under kursen. Tentamen- och räkneövningspoäng räknas ihop sen studerandet har fått minst 9 poäng i tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: Exam + Calculation exercises. The only requirement to pass the course is to get 9/24 points in the exam. A student can get extra points by submitting calculation exercises during the course. These points are taken into account since the student has passed the exam.

organizationName.en: Department of Energy and Mechanical Engineering

workload.fi: Kurssi suoritetaan 2–3 hengen ryhmissä. Erikoistapauksissa kurssi on mahdollista suorittaa yksin, mutta se voi lisätä kurssin kuormittavuutta.
workload.sv: Kursen genomförs i grupper om 2-3 personer. I särskilda fall är det möjligt att genomföra kursen ensam, men detta kan öka kursens arbetsbörda.
workload.en: The course is conducted in groups of 2-3 people. In special cases, it is possible to complete the course alone, but this may increase the workload of the course.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: KIG-C1010 Introduction to geoinformatics KIG-C1040 Paikkatiedon keruu tai vastaavat tiedot
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: KIG-C1010 Introduction to geoinformatics KIG-C1040 Paikkatiedon keruu eller motsvarande förkunskaper
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: KIG-C1010 Introduction to geoinformatics KIG-C1040 Paikkatiedon keruu or equivalent prerequisities

learningOutcomes.fi: Opiskelija tiedostaa vaihtoehdot 3D-aineiston keruuseen ja osaa valita kuhunkin tehtävään soveltuvan aineistonkeruumenetelmän sekä tehdä mittaussuunnitelman 3D-mallinnuksen pohjaksi. Opiskelija kykenee visualisoimaan ja esittelemään tuotetut 3D-mallit sopivassa 3D-ympäristössä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Den studerande förstår alternativen för 3D-datainsamling och kan välja en lämplig datainsamlingsmetod för varje uppgift, samt göra en mätningsplan som grund för 3D-modellering. Studenten kan visualisera och presentera de 3D-modeller som producerats i en lämplig 3D-miljö.
learningOutcomes.en: The student realise the options for 3D data collection and will be able to choose the appropriate data collection method for each task and make a measurement plan as a basis for 3D modelling. The student will be able to visualise and present the 3D models produced in an appropriate 3D environment.

content.fi: Kurssi tarjoaa käytännönläheisen lähestymisen mittauskampanjan suunnitteluun, 3D-aineiston keruuseen, digitaalisten 3D-mallien muodostamiseen sekä 3D-mallien visualisointiin.
content.sv: Kursen ger en praktisk inblick i hur man planerar en mätkampanj, samlar in 3D-data, skapar digitala 3D-modeller och visualiserar 3D-modeller.
content.en: The course provides a practical approach to designing a measurement campaign, collecting 3D data, creating 3D digital models and visualising 3D models.

assesmentMethods.fi:
Kurssin läpäisemiseksi tulee suorittaa hyväksysti jokainen osatehtävä (5 kpl): 
1. Mittaussuunnitelma 
2. Mittauskampanja ja 3D-mittaus 
3. 3D-mallinnus 
4. Visualisointi 
5. Mallin esittely
assesmentMethods.sv:
För att bli godkänd i kursen måste du bli godkänd i varje delmoment (5 enheter):
1. Plan för mätning
2. Mätkampanj och 3D-mätning
3. 3D-modellering
4. Visualisering
5. Presentation av modellen
assesmentMethods.en:
In order to pass the course, you must pass each component (5 units):
1. Measurement plan
2. Measurement campaign and 3D measuring
3. 3D modelling
4. Visualisation
5. Presentation of the model

name.fi: User Research in Product Design, Luento-opetus
name.sv: User Research in Product Design, Föreläsning
name.en: User Research in Product Design, Lecture

workload.fi: Lectures, in-class exercises, and homework assignments.
workload.sv: Lectures, in-class exercises, and homework assignments.
workload.en: Lectures, in-class exercises, and homework assignments.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: None.
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: None.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: None.

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Understand user-centered design principles and ethical research practices in product development.​
  • Select appropriate research methods based on project goals and constraints.​
  • Plan and design user research using diverse methods and techniques, including surveys, interviews, usability testing, and more.​
  • Analyse user research data effectively to inform product design decisions.​
  • Demonstrate effective communication and collaboration within multidisciplinary teams.​
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Understand user-centered design principles and ethical research practices in product development.​
  • Select appropriate research methods based on project goals and constraints.​
  • Plan and design user research using diverse methods and techniques, including surveys, interviews, usability testing, and more.​
  • Analyse user research data effectively to inform product design decisions.​
  • Demonstrate effective communication and collaboration within multidisciplinary teams.​
learningOutcomes.en:
• Understand user-centered design principles and ethical research practices in product development.​
  • Select appropriate research methods based on project goals and constraints.​
  • Plan and design user research using diverse methods and techniques, including surveys, interviews, usability testing, and more.​
  • Analyse user research data effectively to inform product design decisions.​
  • Demonstrate effective communication and collaboration within multidisciplinary teams.​

content.fi:
• Understanding the fundamentals of user-centered design principles and the role of user research in the design process.​
  • Exploring various user research methods, such as surveys, interviews, usability testing, with a focus on when and how to use each method.​
  • How to collect, record, and analyze user research data, including qualitative and quantitative techniques.​
  • How to develop user personas and empathy maps based on research findings to inform design decisions.​
  • Discussing ethical concerns in user research, along with practical exercises and real-world projects that apply the principles learned throughout the course.​
content.sv:
• Understanding the fundamentals of user-centered design principles and the role of user research in the design process.​
  • Exploring various user research methods, such as surveys, interviews, usability testing, with a focus on when and how to use each method.​
  • How to collect, record, and analyze user research data, including qualitative and quantitative techniques.​
  • How to develop user personas and empathy maps based on research findings to inform design decisions.​
  • Discussing ethical concerns in user research, along with practical exercises and real-world projects that apply the principles learned throughout the course.​
content.en:
• Understanding the fundamentals of user-centered design principles and the role of user research in the design process.​
  • Exploring various user research methods, such as surveys, interviews, usability testing, with a focus on when and how to use each method.​
  • How to collect, record, and analyze user research data, including qualitative and quantitative techniques.​
  • How to develop user personas and empathy maps based on research findings to inform design decisions.​
  • Discussing ethical concerns in user research, along with practical exercises and real-world projects that apply the principles learned throughout the course.​

workload.en: Online self-study and participation in a face-to-face workshop at the Design Factory.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course you will
  • be familiar with prototyping methods and machinery available at the Design Factory
  • understand key issues to take into account in workshop safety
  • be able to produce some mechanical, electrical and digital prototypes utilizing select tools

learningOutcomes.en:

  • be able to produce some mechanical, electrical and digital prototypes utilizing select tools

content.fi: This course introduces the prototyping equipment at the Design Factory, including both safety procedures as well as familiarization how to use the electornics, machining, 3D printing workshops as well as the range of other tools available (painting, woodwork, sewing, vinyl cutting etc.). The course starts with an online self-study introduction and safety preparation that can be completed at any time, after which you can enrol to the face-to-face workshop at the prototyping facilities (organized weekly between September and May, excluding holidays).

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, you will
  • have an understanding of the role of radically creative thinking in driving innovation and pursuing novelty in research
  • have an understanding of the role of a sustainable mindset in framing you work for positive societal impact
  • have an understanding of the role of entrepreneurial thinking in developing resilient strategies, enhancing collaboration and identifying opportunities for innovation
  • be able to apply relevant practices and methods from the course to your own field and research design

content.fi: In this course, doctoral students will examine the interconnections between their fields of research and radically creative thinking, entrepreneurial mindsets and opportunities to create sustainable solutions. The course introduces some of the scientific bases of these concepts, combining reflection with exercises to apply core principles and methods in planning the doctoral students' own research to design for impact.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, you will
  • understand different new product development (NPD) process models and development phases
  • recognize indicators that signify the transition between development phases
  • be able to apply common methods in early product development, including need finding and ideation tools

content.fi:
The course introduces new product development (NPD) models and explores the various development phases. Students get to familiarize themselves with various methods and tools commonly used for exploration, ideation and concept development in the early phases of development projects.
This course has been designed so that it can be taken at the same time as MEC-E3001 Product Development Project and MEC-E3080 Global Innovation Practices, but it can also be taken alone. Students majoring in product development should take the course at the same time as MEC-E3001 Product Development Project.

name.fi: Rakennustekniikan historia, filosofia, etiikka ja tulevaisuus, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Byggnadsteknikens historia, filosofi, etik och framtid, Föreläsning
name.en: The history, philosophy, ethics and future of civil engineering, Lecture

workload.fi: Luento-opetus ja siihen liittyvät tehtävät sekä itsenäinen ja ryhmätyöskentely.
workload.sv: Föreläsningar och relaterade övningar, grupparbeten och självständiga uppgifter.
workload.en: Lectures and related exercises, group work and independent work.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Ei esitietovaatimuksia.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: Inga förkunskaper krävas.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: No prerequisites.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin käytyään opiskelija
  • tuntee rakennustekniikan ja sen eri osa-alueiden keskeiset kehityskulut, ja niihin vaikuttaneet tekijät historiasta nykypäivään.
  • tuntee rakentamisen eri toimijoiden keskeiset eettiset ja kestävän kehityksen näkökulmat.
  • tietää keskeiset kestävyystavoitteet rakentamisessa ja keinoja niiden edistämiseksi nykypäivänä ja tulevaisuudessa.
  • tietää, miten ekologiset, teknillistaloudelliset ja muut yhteiskunnalliset näkökulmat linkittyvät toisiinsa.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter avslutad kurs studenten
  • känner till den centrala utvecklingen inom byggnadsteknik och dess olika områden samt de faktorer som har påverkat den från historien till idag.
  • känner till de centrala etiska perspektiven och perspektiven för hållbar utveckling hos olika aktörer inom byggande.
  • känner till de viktigaste hållbarhetsmålen inom byggandet och sätt att främja dem idag och i framtiden.
  • kan se hur ekologiska, teknoekonomiska och andra samhällsperspektiv är sammanlänkade.
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course, the student
  • knows the development of civil engineering and its various fields, and the factors that have influenced them from history to the present day.
  • knows the key ethical and sustainable development perspectives of different actors in construction.
  • knows the key sustainability goals in civil engineering and ways to promote them today and in the future.
  • knows how ecological, techno-economic, and other societal perspectives are interlinked.

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan rakentamisen historiaan, nykypäivään ja tulevaisuuteen sekä käsitellään alan ja sen toimijoiden vastuullisuuteen liittyviä filosofisia ja eettisiä näkökulmia. Lisäksi perehdytään luonnonvarojen käyttöön rakentamisessa sekä rakennusalan mahdollisuuksiin edistää yhteiskuntien ekologisesti kestävämpää kehitystä teknillistaloudellisesti järkevästi.
content.sv: Kursen introducerar byggandets historia, nutid och framtid samt diskuterar filosofiska och etiska perspektiv relaterade till branschens och dess aktörers ansvar. Utöver lär sig studenterna om användningen av naturresurser i byggandet och om byggsektorns möjligheter att främja en mer ekologiskt hållbar samhällsutveckling på ett teknoekonomiskt förnuftigt sätt.
content.en: The course introduces the history, present and future of civil engineering, and discusses philosophical and ethical perspectives related to the responsibility of the industry and its operators. In addition, the students learn about the use of natural resources in civil engineering and the possibilities of the construction sector to promote more ecologically sustainable development of societies in a techno-economically sensible way.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssi arvostellaan osasuoritusten perusteella. Lopullinen arvosana annetaan asteikolla 0-5. Kaikki osasuoritukset on suoritettava hyväksytysti.
assesmentMethods.sv: Kursens slutförande består av de deluppgifter som ska utvärderas och slutbetyget ges på en skala från 0-5. Alla delbetalningar måste slutföras.
assesmentMethods.en: Course consists of evaluated assignments and the final grade is given on a scale of 0-5. All assignments must be passed.

name.fi: Termiset voimalaitokset ja uusiutuva energia, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Termiska kraftwerk och förnybar energi, Föreläsning
name.en: Thermal power plants and renewable energy, Lecture

workload.en: Lectures and independent studying via videos, 24 hTutorials for home work, 24 hExcursion, 3 hSmall scale power plant measurements, 36 hHomework, 46 hShort exams, a 15 min, 2 hTotal= 135 h

prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: ENY-C2001 Thermodynamics and Heat Transfer or equivalent knowledge

learningOutcomes.en:
After taking the course, the students will be able to:
  • Describe the operating principles of steam and gas turbine power plants and is able to recognize the main components of the real industrial facilities.
  • Apply the basic theory of thermodynamics and mass and energy balances for analyzing different components of steam and gas turbine power plants: boilers, turbines and heat exchangers.
  • Apply the basic theories of thermodynamics and mass and energy balances to overall process of steam, gas turbine and combined power plants.
  • Evaluate, recognize and analyze the maximum theoretical performance of the above processes.
  • Act as an active member of the team (6-8 members) while doing the small scale power plant measurements

content.en: Introduction to electricity and heat production. Principles of thermodynamic power cycles and thermodynamic charts, t-S and h-S diagrams. Control volume analysis of energy and mass balances. Design principles of steam boilers 1: Combustion calculations. Design principles of boilers 2: Heat loads of different heat transfer surfaces. Condensing power plants. Combined heat and power production. Thermodynamic analysis of a gas turbines. Combined cycle. Consentrated solar power plants. Geothermal power plants.

assesmentMethods.en: Group work 28%, homework 48% and short exams 24 % of the grade.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: MEC-E1004 Principles of Naval Architecture

learningOutcomes.fi:
Ship resistance: Can describe and classify the flow phenomena responsible for ship resistance. Knows how to assess the effect of hull main dimensions and that of the features of the hull on hull resistance. Understands the principles behind the theoretical and experimental principles, and the influence of scaling laws in relation to model tests.
Ship propulsion: Can explain the principles of action of a screw propeller and that of the water-jet propulsion. Knows how to apply gained knowledge in estimating the required power of a ship. Can describe the effect of flow parameters on propeller cavitation, understands the influence of erosion and can apply this information in the preliminary design of propellers.
Ship maneuvering: Knows the basic indices to describe ship maneuvering and the testing methods to assess performance. Can classify rudder types, knows how the rudder works and can determine the ship directional stability and turning capability.
Ship seakeeping: Can describe the basic building blocks of linear models of ship motions. Can predict ship motions in frequency domain using known sea spectra and tranfer functions. Can classify wave induced loads and describe the origin of loads of different type.

Interaction between the ship hull, propeller and main engine. Ship maneuvering and rudder principles. Principles of ship seakeeping and motion modelling.

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Virtausmekaniikan perusteet. Termodynamiikan perusteet.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: Strömningsmekanik. Termodynamik.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: Basics in thermodynamics. Basics in fluid mechanics.

learningOutcomes.fi: -ILO 1: Opiskelija osaa johtaa lämpöyhtälön sekä selittää sen yhteyden energian säilymislakiin. Opiskelija osaa ratkaista lämpöyhtälön (1d) ja Newtonin jäähtymislain (0d) numeerisesti Matlabilla. Opiskelija osaa piirtää graafeja ja kuvia analysoiden simulointidataa. -ILO 2: Opiskelija osaa käyttää Fourierin ja Newtonin lakeja ripateoriaan sekä lämpöresistanssin laskentaan. Opiskelija osaa käyttää 2d lämmönsiirtodataa ja laskea siitä avainsuureita. Opiskelija osaa formuloida energiabalanssin 2d systeemille.  -ILO 3: Opiskelija osaa kirjoittaa yhtälöt neste ja lämmönsiirto-ongelmalle kanavassa, arvioida energiatasapainon sekä arvioida lämpötilan nousun erilaisissa lämmitysolosuhteissa. Opiskelija osaa varmistaa analyysin käyttäen simulointidataa.  -ILO 4: Opiskelija osaa muodostaa energiabalanssin ulkoiselle lämmönsiirtosysteemille sekä käyttää peruskorrelaatioyhtälöitä lämmönsiirtokertoimen arviointiin. Opiskelija osaa varmistaa analyysin käyttäen simulointidataa.  -ILO 5: Opiskelija osaa valita Nusselt-luku korrelaatioyhtälön erilaisille virtaus-/lämmönsiirtotilanteille mukaanlukien luonnollisen konvektion sekä kiehumisen.
learningOutcomes.sv: - ILO 1: Studenten kan härleda och förklara vad som är värmeekvation, vad är sambandet med energikonserveringslag och lösa värmeekvationen (1d) och Newtons lag om kylning (0d) numeriskt i Matlab. I allmänhet lär sig eleven att rita grafer och bilder från korrelationer eller simuleringsdata. - ILO 2: Studenten kan tillämpa Fouriers och Newtons lagar i fenteori och termisktresistans sammanhang. Vidare kan studenten analysera 2d värmeöverföringsdata i Matlab och formulera en energibalans för 2d system. - ILO 3: Studenten kan skriva de styrande ekvationerna för vätska/värmeflöde i en kanal, uppskatta energibalansen och uppskatta temperaturökning för olika uppvärmningsförhållanden. Studenten kan bekräfta kanalens värmeöverföring med hjälp av genererad/tillhandahållen simuleringsdata. - ILO 4: Studenten kan formulera energibalans för externa flödesvärmeöverföringssystem och använda grundläggande korrelationer. Studenten kan bekräfta analysen med hjälp av genererade/tillhandahållna simuleringsdata. - ILO 5: Studenten kan välja Nusselts talkorrelationsekvationer för olika situationer inklusive naturlig konvektion och kokning.
learningOutcomes.en: - ILO 1: Student can derive and explain what is heat equation, what is the connection to energy conservation and solve the heat equation (1d) and Newton s cooling law (0d) numerically in Matlab. In general, the student learns to plot graphs and images from correlations or simulation data. - ILO 2: Student can apply Fourier's  and Newton's laws in fin theory and thermal resistance context. Further, the student can analyse 2d heat transfer data in Matlab and formulate an energy balance for 2d system. - ILO 3: Student can write the governing equations of fluid/heat flow in a channel, estimate the energy balance and estimate temperature rise for different heating conditions. The student can confirm the channel heat transfer using generated/provided simulation data. - ILO 4: Student can formulate energy balance for external flow heat transfer systems and use basic correlations. The student can confirm the analysis using generated/provided simulation data.  - ILO 5: Student can choose Nusselt number correlation equations for different situations including natural convection and boiling.

content.fi: Kurssi tarjoaa systemaattisen näkökulman lämmönsiirtoilmiöhin. Opiskelija oppii johtumis- ja konvektioilmiöiden lämmönsiirron perusteet sekä pystyy soveltamaan tietojaan numeeriseen dataan jota tarkastellaan kurssin aikana. Opiskelija oppii kirjoittamaan ja käyttämään lyhyitä Matlab ohjelmia, joilla voidaan laskea, visualisoida ja analysoida lämmönsiirto-ongelmia.
content.sv: Kurssen erbjuder an systematisk synvinkel till värmetransfer fenomen. Studenten lär sig om fysik av värmeledning, konvektion och kann också tillämpa sina kunskaper att analysera numerisk data. Dessutom, studenten vill lärä sig at programmera korta Matlab skripter att simulera, visualisera och analysera värmetransfer problemer.
content.en: The course offers a first systematic walk through to heat transfer phenomena. The student learns the physics of conduction, convection and can apply this knowledge to a numerical case study investigated during the course.  Additionally, the student will learn to use short Matlab programs to compute, visualize and analyze heat transfer problems.

assesmentMethods.fi: Viikottaiset kotitehtävät ja tentti. Pääpaino kotitehtävillä.
assesmentMethods.sv: Uppgifter och exam.
assesmentMethods.en: Weekly homework assignments and exam. Most weigth on homework assignments.
