learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin voi suorittaa 2 opintopisteen versiona, jossa keskitytään keskeisiin käsitteisiin, tai 5 opintopisteen versiona, johon kuuluu lisäksi pohdiskeleva kurssitehtävä. Suoritettuaan 2 opintopisteen version opiskelija osaa
  • kuvata, miten yhteiskunnan tarpeet kytkeytyvät merien käyttöön ja miten tämä näkyy erityyppisinä operaationa ja teknisinä ratkaisuna huomioiden taloudelliset ja tekniset näkökulmat,
  • kuvata, miten ja miksi yhteiskunta säätelee merien käyttöä ja tähän liittyviä operaatiota huomioiden vapauteen, ympäristöjalanjälkeen ja turvallisuuteen liittyvät näkökulmat,
  • kuvata, miten teknologiaan, talouteen ja ympäristöön liittyvät trendit vaikuttavat merien käyttöön.
Suoritettuaan 5 opintopisteen version opiskelija osaa lisäksi
  • tunnistaa ja pohtia omaan opintoalaan liittyviä ajankohtaisia merien käytön haasteita ja näihin esitettyjä ratkaisuja
  • pohtia, miten oman opintoalan keskeinen näkökulma merien käyttöön linkittyy muihin kurssilla käsiteltyihin näkökulmiin ja mitä ristiriitoja näkökulmiin liittyy
learningOutcomes.sv:
Kursen kan tas som en 2 studiepoäng version med fokus på nyckelbegreppen eller som en 5 studiepoäng version med ytterligare reflekterande kursarbete. Efter att ha slutfört 2 studiepoäng versionen av kursen kan studenten
  • beskriva, hur samhällets behov är kopplade till användningen av haven och hur detta visar sig som olika typer av operationer och tekniska lösningar med avseende på ekonomiska och tekniska aspekter,
  • beskriva hur och varför samhället reglerar användningen av haven och maritima operationer med avseende på frihet, miljöpåverkan och säkerhet,
  • beskriva hur tekniska, ekonomiska och miljömässiga trender påverkar användningen av haven.
Efter att ha slutfört 5 studiepoäng versionen av kursen kan studenten dessutom
  • identifiera och reflektera över aktuella utmaningar och lösningar för användningen av haven inom sitt studieområde
  • reflektera över hur det centrala perspektivet på användningen av haven inom det egna studieområdet är kopplat till andra perspektiv som behandlas i kursen och vilka konflikter som finns mellan dem
learningOutcomes.en:
The course can be taken as 2 ECTS version focusing on the key concepts or as a 5 ECTS version with additional reflective coursework. After competing the 2 ECTS version of the course the student can
  • describe, how the needs of the society are linked to the use of the seas and how this shows as different type of operations and technical solutions covering economical and technical aspects,
  • describe, how and why the society is regulating the use of the seas and maritime operations covering aspects of freedom, environmental footprint and safety,
  • describe, how technological, economical and environmental trends are affecting the use of the seas.
After completing the 5 ECTS version of the course the student can additionally
  • identify and reflect on current challenges and solutions to the use of the oceans in one's field of study
  • reflect on how the key perspective on the use of the oceans in one's own field of study links to other perspectives covered in the course and what conflicts exist between them

content.fi: Tämä kurssi tarjoaa yleiskatsauksen merten käyttöön eri näkökulmista. Kurssi on suunniteltu kaikille kandidaattitason opiskelijoille, eikä se edellytä aiempaa tietämystä aiheesta. Kurssilla käsitellään merellä tapahtuviin operaatioihin, talouteen, kestävyyteen ja turvallisuuteen liittyviä keskeisiä teemoja sekä valikoituja meritekniikkaan liittyviä aiheita. Päätavoitteena on tutkia, miten voimme käyttää meriä vastuullisesti, yhteiskunnan tarpeet huomioiden ja teknologinen kehitys huomioon ottaen. Opiskelijat oppivat valtamerten maailmanlaajuisesta merkityksestä, merikaupasta, sääntelystä ja meriteknologian ratkaisevasta roolista sinisen kasvun edistämisessä kestävällä ja taloudellisesti toteuttamiskelpoisella tavalla.
content.sv: Denna kurs ger en översikt över användningen av haven ur olika perspektiv. Kursen är utformad för alla studenter på kandidatnivå utan krav på förkunskaper i ämnet. Den täcker viktiga ämnen relaterade till maritima operationer, ekonomi, hållbarhet och säkerhet, samt utvalda ämnen relaterade till marin teknik. Huvudsyftet är att utforska hur vi kan använda haven på ett ansvarsfullt sätt, med hänsyn till samhällets behov och den tekniska utvecklingen. Studenterna kommer att lära sig om oceanernas globala betydelse, sjöfartshandel, reglering och den marina teknikens avgörande roll för att främja blå tillväxt på ett hållbart och ekonomiskt livskraftigt sätt.
content.en: This course provides an overview of the use of the seas from different perspectives. The course is designed for every bachelor-level student with no requirements on prior knowledge on the topic. It covers central aspects of maritime operations, economics, sustainability, safety, and selected technical topics specific to maritime operations. The main goal is to explore how we can use the seas responsibly, meeting the needs of society and taking into account technological developments. Students will learn about the global importance of oceans, maritime trade, regulation and the crucial role of marine technology in promoting blue growth in a sustainable and economically feasible way.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student ...
  • Understands factors leading to hydrological extremes in surface waters [knowledge].
  • Is able to estimate flood and drought extremes using historical data [skill].
  • Is able to quantify lake water balance components and assess regulation impacts on river flow [skills].
  • Understands how predicted climate change impacts on water balance components [knowledge].
  • Is capable of modelling river flow situations, in addition to performing flood risk analyses [skills].
  • Is aware of surface water resources and their distribution at present and in the future [knowledge/identity].

content.fi: Frequency analysis in hydrology; Lake water balance and estimation of its components; Computational fluid dynamics with 1D model; Analyses of flood risk (both ice-covered and open-channel conditions); Regulation of lakes and rivers; Climate variability and hydrology;

name.sv: Geografisk datavetenskap för hållbar utveckling, Föreläsning
name.en: Spatial Data Science for Sustainable Development, Lecture

workload.fi: Luennot (20 h), itsenäinen opiskelu (20 h), harjoitukset (50 h), projektityöskentely (45 h)
workload.sv: Föreläsningar (20 h), självständigt arbete (20 h), övningsarbeten (50 h), projektarbete (45 h)
workload.en: Lectures (20 h), self-study (20 h), assignments (50 h), final project work (45 h)

prerequisites.fi: GIS-E1030 Introduction to Spatial Methods, or similar knowledge
prerequisites.sv: GIS-E1030 Introduction to Spatial Methods, or similar knowledge
prerequisites.en: GIS-E1030 Introduction to Spatial Methods, or similar knowledge

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan
- Opiskelija ymmärtää ja syventää osaamistaan spatiaalisen datatieteen menetelmistä ja tekniikoista
- Opiskelija osaa soveltaa näitä menetelmiä käytännössä Python ohjelmointikielellä kestävään kehitykseen ja globaalimuutokseen liittyvissä kysymyksissä
- Opiskelija osaa hankkia, käsitellä sekä analysoida moderneja geospatiaalisia massa-aineistoja eri dataformaateissa
learningOutcomes.sv: - Studenten förstår och fördjupar sina kunskaper om geografiska datavetenskapliga metoder och tekniker- Studenten kan tillämpa dessa metoder i praktiken med Python-programmeringspråk i frågor relaterade till hållbar utveckling och global förändrin- Studenten kan samla, hantera och analysera modern geografisk massdata i olika dataformat
learningOutcomes.en: After completing this course,- students will understand and deepen their knowledge of a range of modern spatial data science (SDS) techniques and methodologies- students are able to apply SDS methodologies in practice to a range of sustainability/global change related topics with Python programming language- students have skills and understanding how to retrieve, handle and analyze modern big geospatial data in different formats

literature.en: All the materials are distributed on a dedicated open access website with lecture notes, online programming tutorials and literature.
literature.fi: All the materials are distributed on a dedicated open access website with lecture notes, online programming tutorials and literature.
literature.sv: All the materials are distributed on a dedicated open access website with lecture notes, online programming tutorials and literature.

content.fi: Kurssi tarjoaa syvällisen katsauksen spatiaalisen datatieteen menetelmiin joita sovelletaan käytännössä liittyen kestävän kehityksen ja globaalimuutoksen kysymyksiin/aiheisiin. Kurssi kattaa tekniikoita ja mallinnusmenetelmiä joissa hyödynnetään aineistoja niin vektori, rasteri kuin verkostoformaatissa.
content.sv: Kursen ger en djup insikt i moderna metoder för geografisk datavetenskap som tillämpas på olika ämnen / frågor relaterade till hållbarhet och global förändring. Kursen behandlar tekniker och modelleringsmetoder för vektor-, raster, och nätverk dataformat.
content.en: The course provides a deep insight to modern spatial data science methods which are applied to various topics/questions relating to sustainability and global change. The course covers techniques and modeling approaches for vector and raster data formats as well as for data presented using networks.

assesmentMethods.sv: Övningsarbeten och projektarbete.
assesmentMethods.en: Assignments and project work.

workload.fi: Luennot (24 h), harjoitukset (60 h), itsenäinen opiskelu (30 h), valmistautuminen tenttiin + tentti (21 h)
workload.sv: Föreläsningar (24 h), övningsarbeten (60 h), självständigt arbete (30 h), förberedelse för tentamen + tentamen (21 h)
workload.en: Lectures (24 h), assignments (60 h), self-study (30 h), preparation for examination + examination (21 h)

prerequisites.fi: GIS-E1010 Geodesia ja paikannus tai vastaavat tiedot
prerequisites.sv: GIS-E1010 Geodesi och positionering eller motsvarande kunskap.
prerequisites.en: GIS-E1010 Geodesy and positioning or similar knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi: Ymmärtää ja syventää tietämystä erilaisista moderneista geodeettisista mittauksista ja havainnoista, mukaan lukien avaruusgeodeettiset menetelmät. Ymmärtää globaalien ja paikallisten vertausjärjestelmien takana olevat menetelmät ja tiedot. Tutustua erilaisiin sovelluksiin, jotka perustuvat geodesiaan. Ymmärtää, miten geodesiaa käytetään maapallon havainnoinnissa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Att förstå och fördjupa sig i olika moderna geodetiska mätningar och observationer, inklusive rymdgeodetiska metoder. Att förstå metoder och information bakom globala och lokala referenssystem. Att bli bekant med applikationer som använder geodetisk information. Att förstå hur geodesi används inom jordobservation.
learningOutcomes.en: After completing this course, students will understand and deepen their knowledge of a range of modern geodetic measurements and observations, including space geodetic techniques; understand the methods and data behind global and local reference systems; be familiar with applications based on geodesy; and understand how geodesy is used in Earth observation.

content.fi: Kurssilla tutustutaan tarkemmin sekä maan päällä että avaruudessa tapahtuviin geodeettisiin mittauksiin. Erityisesti perehdytään avaruusgeodeettisiin menetelmiin eli satelliittipaikannukseen (GNSS), satelliittilaseriin (SLR), pitkäkantainterferometriaan (VLBI), sekä painovoimasatelliitteihin, muiden joukossa. Kurssi tutustuttaa opiskelijat moderneihin vertausjärjestelmiin sekä näyttää miten geodeettisia mittauksia voidaan käyttää Maapallon liikkeiden sekä Maan päällä tapahtuvien liikkeiden seuraamiseen erilaisissa ajallisissa ja avaruudellisissa mittakaavoissa. Kurssin painopiste voi vaihdella vuodesta toiseen.
content.sv: Kursen ger en djupare insikt i geodetiska mätningar både på jorden och i rymden. Bland annat satellitnavigation (GNSS), satellitlaser (SLR), långbasinterferometri (VLBI) och tyngdkraftsatelliter studeras närmare. Under kursens gång bekantar sig studenterna med moderna referenssystem och hur man kan använda geodetiska mätningar för att följa jordklotets rörelser samt rörelser på jordytan i olika rumsliga och temporala skalor. Kursens fokus kan variera mellan åren.
content.en: The course gives students a deeper understanding of geodetic techniques both on land and in space, with a particular focus on global navigation satellite systems (GNSS), satellite laser ranging (SLR), very long baseline interferometry (VLBI) and gravity satellites, among other topics. The course will familiarize students with modern reference systems and show how geodetic techniques can be used to monitor movements on and of the Earth on different spatial and temporal scales. The focus of the course may vary between years.

name.fi: Introduction to doctoral studies D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Introduction to doctoral studies D, Föreläsning
name.en: Introduction to doctoral studies D, Lecture

workload.fi: Luento-opetus, ennakkotehtävät
workload.sv: Deltagande i undervisningen, förhandsuppgifter
workload.en: Participation in teaching, pre-assignments

prerequisites.fi: Pakolliset esitiedot: Vain tohtoriopiskelijoille, erityisesti heti opintojen alussa.
prerequisites.sv: Obligatoriska förkunskaper: Endast för doktorander, i synnerhet i början av studierna.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: Only for doctoral students, preferably in the beginning of the studies.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan osallistuja
  • On omaksunut tarvittavat tiedot oppimisen ja osaamisen kehittämisen mahdollisuuksista tohtoriopintojen aikana
  • Ymmärtää tieteellisen julkaisemisen periaatteet ja prosessit, julkaisusarjojen laadun mittaamisen, kirjoittajien roolit ja vastuut, ja tutkimuksen laadun arvioinnin kriteerit. Osallistuja on kykenevä soveltamaan tieteellisen kirjoittamisen, lukemisen, ja viitteiden hallinnan taitojaan käytäntöön
  • Hallitsee työnsä vaikuttamisen keinot, ja ymmärtää erilaisten yleisöjen ja viestintäkanavien ominaispiirteet ja käytänteet. Hän osaa soveltaa erilaisia käytänteitä aktiiviseen urasuunnitteluunsa. 
  • on resilientti tutkimuksen epälineaariseen prosessiin; hänen proaktiivinen asenne kysyä apua, tehdä yhteistyötä, ja tarjota apua on vahvistunut
  • on Aallon strategian mukaisesti innostunut laaja-alaisesta ja kriittisestä ongelmanratkaisusta ja oppimisesta tutkimusperustaisesti
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs:
  • Har du förvärvat nödvändiga kunskaper om möjligheter för lärande- och kompetensutveckling under doktorandstudierna
  • Förstår du principerna och processerna för vetenskaplig publicering, mätning av kvaliteten på publikationsserier, författarnas roller och ansvar samt kriterierna för bedömning av forskningens kvalitet. Du kan kan tillämpa dina färdigheter i vetenskapligt skrivande, läsande och referenshantering i praktiken.
  • Du behärskar metoder för inflytande i ditt arbete och förstår särdrag och praxis för olika målgrupper och kommunikationskanaler. Du kan tillämpa olika metoder för aktiv karriärplanering. 
  • Du är motståndskraftig mot den icke-linjära forskningsprocessen: din proaktiva inställning till att be om hjälp, samarbeta och erbjuda hjälp har stärkts.
  • Du är i enlighet med Aaltos strategi entusiastisk över omfattande och kritisk problemlösning och lärande baserat på forskning.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the student
  • Has sufficient knowledge of the opportunities to learn and experience during doctoral studies.
  • Understands basics of the scientific publishing process, quality of journals, roles, and responsibilities of authors and collaborators, and the quality assessment of research. I able to apply advanced and systematic skills in scientific writing, reading, and referencing systems
  • Has tools to define the potential impact of their work and consider different audiences and avenues, and practices for continuous career planning
  • Has resilience to the non-linear process of doctoral studies; strengthened proactive attitude to ask for advice, to collaborate, and to help others
  • Following Aalto strategy, has a desire for problem-solving and learning through research, in a comprehensive and critical manner

content.fi: Merkityksellinen oppiminen ja opetus, tutkimusjohtaminen, tutkimusvaikuttavuus, tutkimusetiikka, uramuotoilu, tieteellinen viestintä ja julkaiseminen, lukemisen ja kirjoittamisen tieteelliset käytänteet, työn imu ja kestävät itsensäjohtamisen käytänteet
content.sv: Meningsfullt lärande och undervisning, forskningsledning, forskningseffekter, forskningsetik, karriärdesign, vetenskaplig kommunikation och publicering, vetenskaplig metoder för att läsa och skriva, arbetsflöde och hållbara metoder för självförvaltning
content.en: Meaningful learning, research management, research impact, research ethics, career design, scientific communication and publishing, scientific practices of reading and writing, flow of work and sustainable self-management practices

Kurssille hyväksyttyjen opiskelijoiden määrä on rajattu, ja valinnassa priorisoidaan Insinööritieteiden tohtoriohjelman uusia väitöskirjatutkijoita. Pidätämme oikeuden olla järjestämättä kurssia, jos ilmoittautuneita on alle viisi opiskelijaa.
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket: engelska Undervisningsperiod: 2024-2025 Höst II  2024-2025 Vår V  2025-2026 Höst II  2025-2026 Vår V Anmälan: Anmälan görs i Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi). Antalet studerande som antas till kursen är begränsat och nya doktorander vid doktorandprogrammet vid Högskolan för ingenjörsvetenskaper prioriteras. Vi förbehåller oss rätten att inte ordna kursen om färre än fem anmäler sig.

prerequisites.fi: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics, REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics
prerequisites.sv: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics, REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics
prerequisites.en: REC-E3100 Real Estate Economics, REC-E3200 Institutions in Real Estate Economics

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, the student is familiar with the basics of housing market equilibrium and dynamics and of housing valuation. The student will understand basics of: the formation of housing market equilibrium; the relationship between housing prices, rents and supply; the important role of housing supply elasticity; the reasons for and outcomes of regional variations in housing market variables; housing price and rent formation at the macro and micro levels; the role of public sector interventions in the housing market.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course, the student is familiar with the basics of housing market equilibrium and dynamics and of housing valuation. The student will understand basics of: the formation of housing market equilibrium; the relationship between housing prices, rents and supply; the important role of housing supply elasticity; the reasons for and outcomes of regional variations in housing market variables; housing price and rent formation at the macro and micro levels; the role of public sector interventions in the housing market.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course, the student is familiar with the basics of housing market equilibrium and dynamics and of housing valuation. The student will understand basics of: the formation of housing market equilibrium; the relationship between housing prices, rents and supply; the important role of housing supply elasticity; the reasons for and outcomes of regional variations in housing market variables; housing price and rent formation at the macro and micro levels; the role of public sector interventions in the housing market.

content.fi: Key actors in the housing market, basic models for housing market long-term equilibrium and short-term dynamics, basic valuation concepts for housing including hedonic valuation and regression, supply elasticity of housing and land leverage, regional differences in key housing market variables, the role of public sector interventions in the housing market.
content.sv: Key actors in the housing market, basic models for housing market long-term equilibrium and short-term dynamics, basic valuation concepts for housing including hedonic valuation and regression, supply elasticity of housing and land leverage, regional differences in key housing market variables, the role of public sector interventions in the housing market.
content.en: Key actors in the housing market, basic models for housing market long-term equilibrium and short-term dynamics, basic valuation concepts for housing including hedonic valuation and regression, supply elasticity of housing and land leverage, regional differences in key housing market variables, the role of public sector interventions in the housing market.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, the student understands the main economic forces that lead to the existence of cities. The student is familiar with the theories related to the emergence of cities and their role on agglomeration, productivity, urban amenities, and congestion. The student is familiar with key/main models of urban economics and understands the determinants of urban land values, and how land values vary within and between cities. The student is familiar with methodologies to evaluate urban characteristics, and the challenges of these methodologies. The student is familiar with the role and challenges related to housing and urban policies.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course the student understands the process and function of market analysis in commercial property markets as well as the dynamics of commercial property markets, including price formation. He/she is familiar with the sources and contents of market data and understands their shortcomings. He/she can apply this knowledge in the valuation of a commercial property using the income approach. In addition to student will be able to analyse, assess and create information by interpreting domestic and foreign research, sources and other information.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student
  • is able to describe the development process and its phases, different actors and their roles.
  • is familiar with land policy and plan implementation tools.
  • is able to describe the relation between planning and development process and varying scopes of development processes.
  • is able to discuss the multidimensional aspects of development process.
  • is able to analyze the content and purpose of development plans.

prerequisites.sv: Perustiedot Suomen oikeusjärjestyksestä ja ympäristöoikeudellisesta sääntelystä.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija ymmärtää
  • ympäristöoikeuden kokonaisuuden ja/tai sen tietyn osa-alueen lainsäädännön ja hallinnollisen päätöksenteon ja menettelyiden problematiikan pääpiirteet
  • kiinteistöliiketoiminnan kannalta keskeisimmät haasteet ja mahdollisuudet
learningOutcomes.sv: Studerande skall efter avklarad kurs känna till centrala miljörättsliga normer, begrepp, principer och rättsinstitut inom de områden kursen behandlar. Studerande skall även kunna identifiera och lösa rättsliga problem genom att använda olika rättskällor.
learningOutcomes.en:
• Recognizes the special matters of the one or several sectors of environmental law. Comprehends the prerequisites of specific sector environmental law and the possibilities development and business provided by it.
  • Comprehends the multiphase administrative procedure in environmental law sector, as well as the particular challenges to development posed by it from a business point of view.

literature.en: To be announced in MyCourses and lectures.
literature.fi: Ilmoitetaan MyCoursesissa ja luennoilla.
literature.sv: Presenteras i MyCourses och föreläsningar.

content.fi:
Kurssillä käsitellään:
  • maankäyttö- ja rakennuslainsäädäntöä
  • ympäristönsuojelulainsäädäntöä
  • luonnonsuojelulainsäädäntöä
  • vesilainsäädäntöä
  • ilmastolainsäädäntöä
  • hallinto-, hallintolainkäyttö- ja kuntalainsäädäntöä sekä perustuslakia
  • EU:n lainsäädäntökehikkoa
Sisältö keskittyy ajankohtaisiin kysymyksiin.
content.sv: Kursen behandlar valda delar av den miljöjuridik som berör affärsverksamhet.
content.en: Environmental, climate and administrative procedure legislation in Finland and EU.

assesmentMethods.en: pass/fail

learningOutcomes.fi:
The intended learning outcomes of the 15 ECTS course are divided in two parts: first part describes the knowledge and context of the field, while the other part the skills required in the field After the completion of the course the student is able to
  • Recognise and describe the main characteristics of the water and environmental engineering field, including its link to sustainability [knowledge]
  • Understand the principles of the hydrological cycle and water resources management, including the role of hydraulic structures [knowledge] 
  • Understand the key principles of good environmental and water quality [knowledge]
  • Define the main aspects of water and environmental services and related infrastructures, particularly those related to water supply and sewerage systems [knowledge]
  • Identify the broader societal context relevant to water and environmental engineering, including the key covernance and entrepreneurial aspects [knowledge]
  • Create his/her Personal Learning Portfolio, and in this way is able to recognise, assess and communicate his/her own key competences and strengths [identity]
  • Work interactively as part of the group, with relevant communication and group working skills [identity]
In addition, the student:
  • knows the key computational methods (see below) related to water and environmental engineering [knowledge]
  • can apply basic water and environmental measurement methods and related basic analyses in the laboratory and in the flume [skill]
  • understands the basic concepts of storing and processing spatial data in GIS [knowledge]
  • knows how linear regression and statistical testing can be applied in water and environmental engineering related problems [knowledge]
  • is able to quantify errors associated with hydro-environmental measurements [skill]
  • understands basic concepts of applying simulation models to problems related to water and environmental engineering [knowledge]
  • is aware of the potential of using computational methods in solving water and environmental problems [identity]

  • Define the main aspects of water and environmental services and related infrastructures, particularly those related to water supply and sewerage systems [knowledge]
  • Identify the broader societal context relevant to water and environmental engineering, including the key covernance and entrepreneurial aspects [knowledge]
  • Create his/her Personal Learning Portfolio, and in this way is able to recognise, assess and communicate his/her own key competences and strengths [identity]
  • Work interactively as part of the group, with relevant communication and group working skills [identity]
In addition, the student:
  • knows the key computational methods (see below) related to water and environmental engineering [knowledge]
  • can apply basic water and environmental measurement methods and related basic analyses in the laboratory and in the flume [skill]
  • understands the basic concepts of storing and processing spatial data in GIS [knowledge]
  • knows how linear regression and statistical testing can be applied in water and environmental engineering related problems [knowledge]
  • is able to quantify errors associated with hydro-environmental measurements [skill]
  • understands basic concepts of applying simulation models to problems related to water and environmental engineering [knowledge]
  • is aware of the potential of using computational methods in solving water and environmental problems [identity]
learningOutcomes.en:
The intended learning outcomes of the 15 ECTS course are divided in two parts: first part describes the knowledge and context of the field, while the other part the skills required in the field After the completion of the course the student is able to
  • Recognise and describe the main characteristics of the water and environmental engineering field, including its link to sustainability [knowledge]
  • Understand the principles of the hydrological cycle and water resources management, including the role of hydraulic structures [knowledge] 
  • Understand the key principles of good environmental and water quality [knowledge]
  • Define the main aspects of water and environmental services and related infrastructures, particularly those related to water supply and sewerage systems [knowledge]
  • Identify the broader societal context relevant to water and environmental engineering, including the key covernance and entrepreneurial aspects [knowledge]
  • Create his/her Personal Learning Portfolio, and in this way is able to recognise, assess and communicate his/her own key competences and strengths [identity]
  • Work interactively as part of the group, with relevant communication and group working skills [identity]
In addition, the student:
  • knows the key computational methods (see below) related to water and environmental engineering [knowledge]
  • can apply basic water and environmental measurement methods and related basic analyses in the laboratory and in the flume [skill]
  • understands the basic concepts of storing and processing spatial data in GIS [knowledge]
  • knows how linear regression and statistical testing can be applied in water and environmental engineering related problems [knowledge]
  • is able to quantify errors associated with hydro-environmental measurements [skill]
  • understands basic concepts of applying simulation models to problems related to water and environmental engineering [knowledge]
  • is aware of the potential of using computational methods in solving water and environmental problems [identity]

content.fi:
The course introduces the key contents and principles of water and environmental engineering, with emphasis on water. The course covers the following themes: sustainability and global resources; environmental and water quality; hydrological cycle and water resources management; and water and environmental services and related infrastructures. The course also introduces the general setting for water and environmental engineering field.
The course introduces the key computational methods related to water and environmental engineering: the use of spatial analysis/GIS in water and environment related problems; application of statistical methods; calibration, validation, and application of environmental simulation models; and measurements in the laboratory and in the hydraulic flume.
The course is structured according to weekly themes, with each week providing introduction to a selected theme and including individual and/or group assignments specific for that theme. The weekly themes are coordinated by Thematic Leaders (WAT staff).
During the course, the WAT Master s Students also create their Personal Learning Portfolio, building on their existing skills and knowledge as well as their studies. The portfolio process runs through the entire duration of the Master s studies, and includes meetings with peer students and mentors. Non-WAT Master s Students compensate the portfolio work with additional assignment done at the end of the course.

prerequisites.fi: KJR-C2003 Basic course on fluid mechanics or equivalent knowledge
prerequisites.sv: KJR-C2003 Basic course on fluid mechanics or equivalent knowledge
prerequisites.en: KJR-C2003 Basic course on fluid mechanics or equivalent knowledge

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Ability to describe physical background of typical flow phenomena in laminar and turbulent flow fields
  • Ability to explain the physical meaning of the fundamental flow equations and of the terms in the equations, how the equations are formed and to apply the equations to describe simple flow cases
  • Ability to describe the fundamental characteristics of boundary layer flow, to form the equations for boundary layer flow and to apply the equations to study the behaviour of boundary layer flows
  • Ability to explain, what turbulence is, what are the fundamental concepts related to it and how turbulence is typically modelled
  • Ability to describe the formulation of discretised flow equations using finite difference method, common characteristics of selected discretisation schemes, sources of uncertainty in numerical predictions and concept of verification and validation and to estimate the truncation error of selected schemes

  • Ability to describe the fundamental characteristics of boundary layer flow, to form the equations for boundary layer flow and to apply the equations to study the behaviour of boundary layer flows
  • Ability to explain, what turbulence is, what are the fundamental concepts related to it and how turbulence is typically modelled
  • Ability to describe the formulation of discretised flow equations using finite difference method, common characteristics of selected discretisation schemes, sources of uncertainty in numerical predictions and concept of verification and validation and to estimate the truncation error of selected schemes

literature.en: Kundu and Cohen, Fluid Mechanics (4th edition)
literature.fi: Kundu and Cohen, Fluid Mechanics (4th edition)
literature.sv: Kundu and Cohen, Fluid Mechanics (4th edition)

content.fi: The aim of the course is to deepen your understanding of the physical background of fluid flow phenomena (particularly the influence of viscosity) and the mathematical description and solution of different fluid flow problems. It is assumed that you already have a basic understanding of fluid flow (e.g. conservation principles, kinematics, material derivative, pressure, shear stress, Bernoulli equation). We will shortly revise the derivation of the fundamental flow equations to give you an idea of the fundamental physical processes in fluid flow. We will discuss the possibilities for the solution of Navier-Stokes equations in their full form and the simplifications and solution of the equations in specific cases with particular emphasis on boundary layer and boundary layer like flows. You will learn what turbulence is, how it affects the mean flow and how it is typically handled in the mathematical model. You will also get an introduction to the numerical solution of the flow equations.

learningOutcomes.fi: Student knows the concepts and principles of the finite element method, is able to apply engineering paradigm in structure and machine modeling, derive the element contributions of the beam and plate models, build the equilibrium equations of structures from element contributions, and solve the equations for the nodal displacements and rotations.

prerequisites.fi: MEC-E1004 Principles of Naval Architecture, MEC-E1030 Random loads and processes (recommended)
prerequisites.sv: MEC-E1004 Principles of Naval Architecture, MEC-E1030 Random loads and processes (recommended)
prerequisites.en: MEC-E1004 Principles of Naval Architecture, MEC-E1030 Random loads and processes (recommended)

learningOutcomes.fi: The aim of the course is to introduce the student how the first principles of mechanics are applied to the ship structural design. After the course the student knows: how the ship structure affects the safety, production and maintainability of the ship (function of ship structure); how the ship is constructed from plates and beams (ship construction method); how the structural design is linked to the other ship design disciplines (structural design principles ); how loads, response and strength are connected and when these can be assessed separately for different hierarchical levels (strength analysis of ship hull) and how the principles of mechanics are utilized in ship structural design rules and what are the limitations of the rules (limit state analysis in ship structural design).
learningOutcomes.sv: The aim of the course is to introduce the student how the first principles of mechanics are applied to the ship structural design. After the course the student knows: how the ship structure affects the safety, production and maintainability of the ship (function of ship structure); how the ship is constructed from plates and beams (ship construction method); how the structural design is linked to the other ship design disciplines (structural design principles ); how loads, response and strength are connected and when these can be assessed separately for different hierarchical levels (strength analysis of ship hull) and how the principles of mechanics are utilized in ship structural design rules and what are the limitations of the rules (limit state analysis in ship structural design).
learningOutcomes.en: The aim of the course is to introduce the student how the first principles of mechanics are applied to the ship structural design. After the course the student knows: how the ship structure affects the safety, production and maintainability of the ship (function of ship structure); how the ship is constructed from plates and beams (ship construction method); how the structural design is linked to the other ship design disciplines (structural design principles ); how loads, response and strength are connected and when these can be assessed separately for different hierarchical levels (strength analysis of ship hull) and how the principles of mechanics are utilized in ship structural design rules and what are the limitations of the rules (limit state analysis in ship structural design).

literature.en: A. Mansour & D. Liu, Strength of Ships and Ocean Structures , The Principles of Naval Architecture Series, SNAME 2008; Richard Lee Storch et al. Ship production (Selected chapters), SNAME 2015; Selected articles and reading material

content.fi: General design aspects; Loads on marine structures; Analysis of stress and deflection of hull girder and substructures; Load-carrying capability and structural performance; Reliability; Material selection and production.
content.sv: General design aspects; Loads on marine structures; Analysis of stress and deflection of hull girder and substructures; Load-carrying capability and structural performance; Reliability; Material selection and production.
content.en: General design aspects; Loads on marine structures; Analysis of stress and deflection of hull girder and substructures; Load-carrying capability and structural performance; Reliability; Material selection and production.

assesmentMethods.fi: The course applies a learning concept in which the teaching events are aligned with students' structural design work. This work is composed systematically with the help of weekly assignments. A weekly learning cycle includes personal pre-assignment, interactive lecture, question hour, and assignment work. The weekly assignments submitted every two or three weeks composed the project work at the end of the course. The assignment and project work will be done by a 2- or 3-person group. Pre-assignments and final exams measure personal learning. The course grade is based on personal work (Pre-assignments 15%, Final exam 40%) and group-based work (Weekly assignments  30%, Final project report  15%).

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course, the student can:
  • Solve wide energy-related problems as a part of a group
  • Understand the different parts of a project contract and conduct one with university and company
  • Adopt an entrepreneurial mindset
  • Function as a member of a multidisciplinary project team
  • Understand the basics of business strategy
  • Utilize one's own capabilities and expertise in project environment
  • Pitch and give group presentation of a project's results
  • Consult a network of peers and company representatives

content.fi: The students solve energy-related problems in interdisciplinary teams concerning the emergence of new innovations. The course requires active communication with companies and adopting an entrepreneurial mindset. In initiating the work, the students need to identify customer needs, the wider value chain and to pitch a project concept to the company. Development targets may include services, business models, technical solutions or prototypes and the final outcome will be a report and an accompanying presentation. Each group is assigned an instructor from the university. The course provides workshops to support the project development incorporating the best Aalto and external guest experts on different entrepreneurial and worklife skills.

name.fi: Basic course on fluid mechanics, Luento-opetus

name.en: Basic course on fluid mechanics, Lecture

workload.fi: The course workload for the students: Lectures (2h x 12 kpl) x 2 = 48 h Essay 15 h   Exercises 6 kpl x 8 h = 48 h MyCourses Quizzes 12 x 0.5 h = 6 h Exam 4h + 21 h = 25 h Total   142 h ~ 5 ECTS Participation to the lectures is not compulsory (although recommended).

prerequisites.fi: There are no compulsory prerequisites.  It is recommended to complete the mathematics courses before COE-C2003. It is also beneficial to complete COE-C1001/KJR-C1001 Statics and dynamics -course before COE-C2003.

learningOutcomes.fi: As a student: 1.       you master the central terminology of fluid mechanics and you can explain the meaning of the central concepts As a student, you can 2.     apply the concept of fixed control volume for a traveling fluid particle, or the concept of moving with the traveling fluid            particle 3.      apply dimensional analysis to scale test results 4.      analyze the effect of pressure in a stagnant or in a moving fluid 5.      solve problems with Matlab 6.    write critically reflective and structured scientific text As a student, you understand: 7.    the significance of conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems 8.    the influence of losses in fluid flow problems 9.    flow behavior in pipe flows or boundary layer flows
learningOutcomes.sv: As a student: 1.       you master the central terminology of fluid mechanics and you can explain the meaning of the central concepts As a student, you can 2.     apply the concept of fixed control volume for a traveling fluid particle, or the concept of moving with the traveling fluid            particle 3.      apply dimensional analysis to scale test results 4.      analyze the effect of pressure in a stagnant or in a moving fluid 5.      solve problems with Matlab 6.    write critically reflective and structured scientific text As a student, you understand: 7.    the significance of conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems 8.    the influence of losses in fluid flow problems 9.    flow behavior in pipe flows or boundary layer flows

literature.en: The course book: Young, Munson, Okiishi, Huebsch (2011) Introduction to Fluid Mechanics 5th Edition with SI-units. In addition, there will be lecture slides distributed during the lectures and accompanying lecture notes which are also distributed.
literature.fi: The course book: Young, Munson, Okiishi, Huebsch (2011) Introduction to Fluid Mechanics 5th Edition with SI-units. In addition, there will be lecture slides distributed during the lectures and accompanying lecture notes which are also distributed.
literature.sv: The course book: Young, Munson, Okiishi, Huebsch (2011) Introduction to Fluid Mechanics 5th Edition with SI-units. In addition, there will be lecture slides distributed during the lectures and accompanying lecture notes which are also distributed.

content.fi:
The main contents of the course are listed below:
  1. The effect of pressure on a fluid
  2. The Bernoulli equation, the energy equation, and the significance of losses.
  3. The control volume approach
  4. Conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems
  5. Dimensional analysis on e.g. model tests
  6. Pipe and boundary layer flows
  7. Introduction to Matlab
  8. Essay writing within the field of fluid mechanics

  5. Dimensional analysis on e.g. model tests
  6. Pipe and boundary layer flows
  7. Introduction to Matlab
  8. Essay writing within the field of fluid mechanics

The main contents of the course are listed below:
  1. The effect of pressure on a fluid
  2. The Bernoulli equation, the energy equation, and the significance of losses.
  3. The control volume approach
  4. Conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems
  5. Dimensional analysis on e.g. model tests
  6. Pipe and boundary layer flows 
  7. Introduction to Matlab
  8. Essay writing within the field of fluid mechanics

assesmentMethods.fi: The final exam contributes to 50% of the total course grade. The other half of the grade comes from exercises, essay, and MC Quizes (distribution between exercises, essay, and Quizes is 75%, 15%, and 10%). Exam: In the exam there are 5 tasks that are graded between 0-6 points. Four tasks will be based on calculations and one will be a conceptual problem. Before the exam, an exam bank is given out consisting of 24 tasks of which 1-2 will be in the exam. In addition, at least one task from the exercises will be in the exam. One problem will be a surprize task. The amount of points needed for passing the exam is 11 (+-1 one point). Exercises: There is one exercise per week during the course, a total of 6 exercises. Each exercise consist of 4 tasks. One of the tasks per week will be solved by Matlab. The maximum points per week is 12 (3 points per task). The minimum points needed for passing the course is 50% from the max

workload.fi: The course workload for the students: Lectures (2h x 12 kpl) x 2 = 48 h Essay 15 h   Exercises 6 kpl x 8 h = 48 h MyCourses Quizzes 12 x 0.5 h = 6 h Exam 4h + 21 h = 25 h Total   142 h ~ 5 ECTS Participation to the lectures is not compulsory (although recommended).

prerequisites.fi: There are no compulsory prerequisites.  It is recommended to complete the mathematics courses before COE-C2003. It is also beneficial to complete COE-C1001/KJR-C1001 Statics and dynamics -course before COE-C2003.
prerequisites.sv: There are no compulsory prerequisites.  It is recommended to complete the mathematics courses before COE-C2003. It is also beneficial to complete COE-C1001/KJR-C1001 Statics and dynamics -course before COE-C2003.

learningOutcomes.fi: As a student: 1.       you master the central terminology of fluid mechanics and you can explain the meaning of the central concepts As a student, you can 2.     apply the concept of fixed control volume for a traveling fluid particle, or the concept of moving with the traveling fluid            particle 3.      apply dimensional analysis to scale test results 4.      analyze the effect of pressure in a stagnant or in a moving fluid 5.      solve problems with Matlab 6.    write critically reflective and structured scientific text As a student, you understand: 7.    the significance of conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems 8.    the influence of losses in fluid flow problems 9.    flow behavior in pipe flows or boundary layer flows

learningOutcomes.en: As a student: 1.       you master the central terminology of fluid mechanics and you can explain the meaning of the central concepts As a student, you can 2.     apply the concept of fixed control volume for a traveling fluid particle, or the concept of moving with the traveling fluid            particle 3.      apply dimensional analysis to scale test results 4.      analyze the effect of pressure in a stagnant or in a moving fluid 5.      solve problems with Matlab 6.    write critically reflective and structured scientific text As a student, you understand: 7.    the significance of conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems 8.    the influence of losses in fluid flow problems 9.    flow behavior in pipe flows or boundary layer flows

literature.en: The course book: Young, Munson, Okiishi, Huebsch (2011) Introduction to Fluid Mechanics 5th Edition with SI-units. In addition, there will be lecture slides distributed during the lectures and accompanying lecture notes which are also distributed.
literature.fi: The course book: Young, Munson, Okiishi, Huebsch (2011) Introduction to Fluid Mechanics 5th Edition with SI-units. In addition, there will be lecture slides distributed during the lectures and accompanying lecture notes which are also distributed.
literature.sv: The course book: Young, Munson, Okiishi, Huebsch (2011) Introduction to Fluid Mechanics 5th Edition with SI-units. In addition, there will be lecture slides distributed during the lectures and accompanying lecture notes which are also distributed.

content.fi:
The main contents of the course are listed below:
  1. The effect of pressure on a fluid
  2. The Bernoulli equation, the energy equation, and the significance of losses.
  3. The control volume approach
  4. Conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems
  5. Dimensional analysis on e.g. model tests
  6. Pipe and boundary layer flows
  7. Introduction to Matlab
  8. Essay writing within the field of fluid mechanics
content.sv:
The main contents of the course are listed below:

  2. The Bernoulli equation, the energy equation, and the significance of losses.
  3. The control volume approach
  4. Conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems
  5. Dimensional analysis on e.g. model tests
  6. Pipe and boundary layer flows
  7. Introduction to Matlab
  8. Essay writing within the field of fluid mechanics
content.en:
The main contents of the course are listed below:
  1. The effect of pressure on a fluid
  2. The Bernoulli equation, the energy equation, and the significance of losses.
  3. The control volume approach
  4. Conservation of mass, momentum, and angular momentum in fluid flow problems
  5. Dimensional analysis on e.g. model tests
  6. Pipe and boundary layer flows 
  7. Introduction to Matlab
  8. Essay writing within the field of fluid mechanics

assesmentMethods.fi: The final exam contributes to 50% of the total course grade. The other half of the grade comes from exercises, essay, and MC Quizes (distribution between exercises, essay, and Quizes is 75%, 15%, and 10%). Exam: In the exam there are 5 tasks that are graded between 0-6 points. Four tasks will be based on calculations and one will be a conceptual problem. Before the exam, an exam bank is given out consisting of 24 tasks of which 1-2 will be in the exam. In addition, at least one task from the exercises will be in the exam. One problem will be a surprize task. The amount of points needed for passing the exam is 11 (+-1 one point). Exercises: There is one exercise per week during the course, a total of 6 exercises. Each exercise consist of 4 tasks. One of the tasks per week will be solved by Matlab. The maximum points per week is 12 (3 points per task). The minimum points needed for passing the course is 50% from the max

prerequisites.fi: GEO-E1040 Rock Excavation is recommened.
prerequisites.sv: GEO-E1040 Rock Excavation is recommened.
prerequisites.en: GEO-E1040 Rock Excavation is recommened.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the completion of the course the student is able to - use rock classificationsystems for estimation of rock mass properties
- analyze the behavior of rock mass as discontinuous, heterogeneous and partly unknown material under stress field
- perform rudimentary stability analysis
- select appropriate laboratory and field test methods for rock mass characterization

name.fi: Foundation Engineering and Ground Improvement, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Foundation Engineering and Ground Improvement, Föreläsning
name.en: Foundation Engineering and Ground Improvement, Lecture

workload.fi: Total 132h (5cr): Lectures 26h Exercises 14h Homeworks 50h Independent study 46h
workload.sv: Total 132h (5cr): Lectures 26h Exercises 14h Homeworks 50h Independent study 46h
workload.en: Total 132h (5cr): Lectures 26h Exercises 14h Homeworks 50h Independent study 46h

prerequisites.fi: GEO-E1020 Geotechnics
prerequisites.sv: GEO-E1020 Geotechnics
prerequisites.en: GEO-E1020 Geotechnics

learningOutcomes.fi:
1. Student can plan ground surveys and interpret the results of investigations and based on this choose an appropriate founda-tion method for different ground conditions and can calculate its bearing capacity.
2. Student can calculate stability of excavations and embankments and select suitable ground improvement method.
3. Student identifies the most common ground improvements methods and relevant earth construction techniques.
4. Student can select correct drainage and frost protection method for buildings and sites.
5. Student learns to use the geotechnical calculation tools and to solve stability and settlement problems.
6. Student learns critical thinking and problem solving.
7. Students learns to do design using modern and traditional meth-ods and report the results.
8. Student identities as an expert and developer of the field
9. Understand the problems of the field from the point of view of users and technical and social systems, as well as from that of the environment

prerequisites.fi: MS-A000x Matrix algebra,  MS-A010x Differential and integral calculus 1 or corresponding knowledge.
prerequisites.sv: MS-A000x Matrix algebra,  MS-A010x Differential and integral calculus 1 or corresponding knowledge.
prerequisites.en: MS-A000x Matrix algebra,  MS-A010x Differential and integral calculus 1 or corresponding knowledge.

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Understand the main concepts of continuum mechanics: material (Lagrange) and spatial (Euler) representations, transition and velocity fields
  • Understand deformation and stress state concepts and mathematical representations: deformation and deformation speed sensor, traction and stress tensor
  • Understand the concepts and mathematical representations of the continuum equilibrium and balance equations: mass conservation, momentum and momentum balances, energy balance
  • Is familiar with the basic concepts of constitutive modeling of the continuum and basic solid-liquid thermomechanical models
  • Understand how to mathematically describe the behavior of materials in engineering using the principles of continuum mechanics
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Understand the main concepts of continuum mechanics: material (Lagrange) and spatial (Euler) representations, transition and velocity fields
  • Understand deformation and stress state concepts and mathematical representations: deformation and deformation speed sensor, traction and stress tensor
  • Understand the concepts and mathematical representations of the continuum equilibrium and balance equations: mass conservation, momentum and momentum balances, energy balance
  • Is familiar with the basic concepts of constitutive modeling of the continuum and basic solid-liquid thermomechanical models
  • Understand how to mathematically describe the behavior of materials in engineering using the principles of continuum mechanics
learningOutcomes.en:
• Understand the main concepts of continuum mechanics: material (Lagrange) and spatial (Euler) representations, transition and velocity fields
  • Understand deformation and stress state concepts and mathematical representations: deformation and deformation speed sensor, traction and stress tensor
  • Understand the concepts and mathematical representations of the continuum equilibrium and balance equations: mass conservation, momentum and momentum balances, energy balance
  • Is familiar with the basic concepts of constitutive modeling of the continuum and basic solid-liquid thermomechanical models
  • Understand how to mathematically describe the behavior of materials in engineering using the principles of continuum mechanics

content.fi:
• what is a continuum
  • kinematics of a Continuum: displacement, deformation and configuration, material and spatial descriptions, strain, rate of deformation
  • stress state: stress tensor and traction (stress vector)
  • balance, conservation laws and thermodynamics principles: conservation of Mass, Momentum and Energy
  • constitutive equations: Solid and Fluid mechanics, and Heat Transfer
  • engineering applications

learningOutcomes.fi: Student knows the basic analysis types of machines and structures and the role of the principle of virtual work in the analyses, is able to determine the vibration properties of beam structures, to find the critical load for buckling of a beam structure, to model a non-linear bar structure, and perform thermo-mechanical analyses of bar and thin-slab structures.
learningOutcomes.sv: Student knows the basic analysis types of machines and structures and the role of the principle of virtual work in the analyses, is able to determine the vibration properties of beam structures, to find the critical load for buckling of a beam structure, to model a non-linear bar structure, and perform thermo-mechanical analyses of bar and thin-slab structures.
learningOutcomes.en: Student knows the basic analysis types of machines and structures and the role of the principle of virtual work in the analyses, is able to determine the vibration properties of beam structures, to find the critical load for buckling of a beam structure, to model a non-linear bar structure, and perform thermo-mechanical analyses of bar and thin-slab structures.

name.fi: Beam, Plate and Shell Models D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Beam, Plate and Shell Models D, Föreläsning
name.en: Beam, Plate and Shell Models D, Lecture

prerequisites.fi: Basics of continuum mechanics, vector algebra, variation calculus, and boundary value problems.
prerequisites.sv: Basics of continuum mechanics, vector algebra, variation calculus, and boundary value problems.
prerequisites.en: Basics of continuum mechanics, vector algebra, variation calculus, and boundary value problems.

learningOutcomes.fi: Student is able to represent the quantities and operators of continuum mechanics in different coordinate systems, knows the assumptions of the beam and plate models and derivation of the beam and plate equations using the principle of virtual work, and is able to write the equations in different coordinate system in flat and curved geometry and solve for the displacements in simple cases.
learningOutcomes.sv: Student is able to represent the quantities and operators of continuum mechanics in different coordinate systems, knows the assumptions of the beam and plate models and derivation of the beam and plate equations using the principle of virtual work, and is able to write the equations in different coordinate system in flat and curved geometry and solve for the displacements in simple cases.
learningOutcomes.en: Student is able to represent the quantities and operators of continuum mechanics in different coordinate systems, knows the assumptions of the beam and plate models and derivation of the beam and plate equations using the principle of virtual work, and is able to write the equations in different coordinate system in flat and curved geometry and solve for the displacements in simple cases.
